dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: E.c.U. OF A HAND GRIPPING A .45 CALIBER AUTOMATIC. The he beating continues as we TILT UP to reveal the face of undercover narcotics detective CHARLIE DESANTIS (30s). He unkempt with wild long hair, goatee and beard. The gruff and scruffy cop is leaning his back against a c door, hiding. He is nervous and shaking -- panting and sweating like a thirsty animal. Obviously scared for his life. In the b.g. we barely make out the sounds of RANDOM GUNSH ECHOING THROUGH THE AIR. With each shot, DeSantis flinche just a bit. These gunshots are faint, though. Dimmed out the deep, pulsating sound of the detectiveвЂ™s HEART BEAT

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Hiding next to DeSantis is his partner JEFF SPEARS (30s) scruffy and unkempt. Spears looks to have had a few more years on the force. In his eyes we see that he is also visibly frightened. The two men are undercover and have just closed in ona suspect. It appears that a deal has just gone bad. Very bad. The constant barrage of gunfire SHATTERS THE WINDOWS THE PARKED CAR. Shards of glass attack the two men as the cover themselves from harm.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: In a slow and steady movement...the detective stands and rests his hands on the roof of the unmarked squad car -- aiming his weapon down the street and in the direction of their suspect RAMON VASQUEZ (30s) also hiding safely behi row of parked cars. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VASQUEZ
dialogues.text: instantly returning the cops fire with shots from a large automatic machine gun. Like an uzi, only more high-tech a deadly.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: quickly ducks down, dodging the gunfire and hitting the ground with his partner.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: continues to sit in a state of shock, unable to move due gunshot wound to the leg. He peeks from the corner of his eye and turns his head slightly -- HIS P.O.V. He notices a young boy (7) trapped under his bicycle. He erying and covering his ears -- muffling the deafening gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: wants desperately to help the child but cannot move.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: turns and notices his partnerвЂ™s catatonia. He abruptly him by the collar and mouths the words вЂњGet the boy!вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: simply cannot move an inch.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: recklessly runs into the line of fire to cover the young child. He instantly catches some stray fire in the back a falls, wounded. As he struggles to get up, he manages to pull the boy from his bicycle -- almost out of harmвЂ™s w Unfortunately, the detective cannot dodge the constant bl of sporadic gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: watches as his partner is hit with several more shots as and the boy struggle to take cover behind the vehicle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: falls to the ground, dying.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY
dialogues.text: lay still on the ground, frozen and unable to move.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: desperately reaches out to the boy -- who is crying heavi

dialogues.speaker: THE BOY
dialogues.text: reaches his arm to DeSantis -- who successfully pulls him from the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: holds the scared child in his arms as BULLETS CONTINUE TO SPRAY THE VEHICLE theyвЂ™re hiding behind. The detective and notices --

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: desperately reaching his hand out to him, begging for hel He is blood-soaked, dying. He mouths the words вЂњHelp me Before DeSantis can react we quickly... cur TO: INT. DESANTISвЂ™ HOME - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT DESANTIS jumping up and awaking from the nightmare. He is completely drenched in sweat and cannot catch his breath. slowly manages to compose himself. The detective is a ver different looking man than in his dream. Short hair, no beard. Just some five oвЂ™clock shadow. He lays on a beaten, old couch in the middle of his livin room. The coffee table before him is completely covered w EMPTY LIQUOR AND BEER BOTTLES. Not five or six, but forty fifty bottles. The floor surrounding him is also covered with empty bottles and other trash. DeSantis calms himself -- looks down at his pants and not that heвЂ™s urinated. A few moments pass before he stands continues toward the bathroom to get cleaned up. As he passes through the filthy home, he kicks and muddles his through the trash and debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis enters and flicks on the light. Without hesitati he removes his pants and tosses the urine soaked sweat pa into the bathtub -- which is filled with ten or more othe pairs of urine stained sweats and boxers. We stay on the bathtub a few moments... taking it all in. This is a sad, deeply haunted and disturbed man. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, dusty motel in the middle of nowhere. A NEON VACANCY SIGN FLICKERS on and off. A total of three cars s parked in the dusty lot. The night is suspiciously quiet, with only a slight wind in the air.

The long stretch of road in front of the motel is empty. seems to stretch into eternity with no sign of a vehicle sight. Then...suddenly...TWO BRIGHT HEADLIGHTS are seen i the distance. A CAR coming up the road. The LIGHTS become BRIGHTER and BRIGHTER as the car draws nearer. As it becomes visible we see that itвЂ™s a Grey D PICK-UP with a DIRT BIKE mounted in the cab. The truck dr nearer to the motel, turns into the barren lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck parks in an empty spot. From the truck steps an unseen MAN, from the waist down. WeвЂ™1ll call him вЂњThe CowboyвЂќ. Dressed in typical cowboy apparel. Blue jeans, boots. He steps to the rear of the vehicle and pulls a lo AREA RUG from the truckвЂ™s cab. He begins toward the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cowboy enters, leaving the door wide open. We see a p of HANDS in RUBBER GLOVES as he unrolls the rug in front the bathroom door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: A PINK BLOUSE and pair of BLUE JEANS lay on the un-made b The man grabs the clothing and stuffs it into a large gar bag. A PICTURE appears to be missing on the motel room wall. There is a hook where a picture used to hang. We TILT DOW to reveal several shards of BROKEN GLASS AND A SHATTERED PICTURE AND FRAME on the carpet. Suddenly...A HAND reaches down and grabs the picture from floor. He tosses the broken picture frame into the garbag bag.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: The cowboy grabs the white shower curtain and pulls it fr its rings. As the shower curtain is removed we are shocke to see A BLOODY HANDPRINT on the shower wall. The print i small and delicate. The print of a young woman. We then quickly... CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: INT. MENвЂ™S LOCKER ROOM - L.A.P.D. - DAY DeSantis opens up his locker and packs a few personal belongings into a small gym bag. This includes a nickel- plated .22 CALIBER HANDGUN. His backup weapon. Taped to t inside of his locker door is a PHOTO of a young woman (20 blonde and beautiful. DeSantis spots the photo out of the corner of his eye. He takes a moment and gazes at the you woman. He peels it from the locker door and tosses it int his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind his desk. We stay on the front door as we not DESANTIS approaching it from the other side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the VOICE OF CAPTAIN GRUBER on the telephone as DeSantis peers through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just got off the phone with IA five minutes ago and got an earful. DeSantis gives a quick knock before entering.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I got trouble knocking on my door right now. I/вЂ™11 call you later. DeSantis shuts the door behind him and stands respectivel with his hands crossed and rested on his lap. We hear Captain Gruber HANGING UP A PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I hear youвЂ™ve officially requested a stress leave. Ninety days?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s right. The sound of Captain Gruber shifting in his chair, sighin uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well thatвЂ™s pretty damn irregular considering the present circumstances, donвЂ™t you think, DeSantis? The detective doesnвЂ™t respond. His eyes remain locked o Captain. He doesnвЂ™t even blink.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Put yourself in my shoes, Charlie. ItвЂ™s only been two weeks since IA cleared you on assault charges and now youвЂ™re asking for a three month leave.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I know how it must look.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GRUBER
dialogues.text: Good. Cos it looks real fuckinвЂ™ bad. I went to bat for you with Internal Affairs to convince them you werenвЂ™t losing it. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN GRUBER (0.S.) (cont'd) Now youвЂ™re going on a psycho leave and giving them every excuse to re- open the investigation.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I need to figure some things out. About this place. About where I stand.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So youвЂ™re thinking about a transfer?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Like I said...I need some time. ThatвЂ™s all I can really tell you right now.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: All right. You listen and listen good. We slowly close on DeSantisвЂ™ face.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN GRUBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: As far as IвЂ™m concerned if you wanna run off for three months and ruin your record, thatвЂ™s fine with me. But let me make one thing crystal clear to you. I donвЂ™t want you in this building. I donвЂ™t want to see you. I donвЂ™t wanna hear about you harassing Vasquez. The best advice I can give you...get the hell as far away from here as possible. Cos Internal Affairs will be watching and so will I. A slight grin on DeSantis as the Captain approves his thr month leave. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera travels quickly down a two lane desert road. A ORANGE SUN AND SKY illuminate the RED DESERT TERRAIN. Itв beautiful. Nothing bad could ever happen here.  INT. DESANTISвЂ™ CAR The detective cruises down the long desert highways of Ut He passes the time by anxiously flipping through the chan on his stereo -- not picking up much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis slowly passes through the downtown avenues of Bryerson, Utah. Population 3,459. ItвЂ™s an old fashioned burg that hasnвЂ™t seen a touch of remodeling since the Eisenhower years. The streets consist mostly of small, family owned busines and shops. An old movie palace, five and dime stores. An ice cream parlor, etc. ItвЂ™s very quaint in a dull and d kind of way. INT. DESANTISвЂ™ CAR He peeks out his window and spots the SheriffвЂ™s office near distance. He slows to a halt, approaching the front door of the office. A SIGN ON THE WINDOW reads вЂњClosed Sunday dinnerвЂќ. DeSantis grins at the sign -- shaking his head in amuseme He continues down the street, headed for Sunday dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis pulls up to the front of the home. A real down h southern cottage with a giant front yard and picket fence Children are running about the yard, playing tag, wrestin rough-housing. The detective attempts to park but there are cars up and both sides of the street -- as far as the eye can see. DeSantis stares in amusement at the very basic innocence this town.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Can Opey come out and play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The backyard is where the party is. A barbecue is going. Music is playing. And rows of townspeople sit at picnic tables, eating, socializing. Enjoying the simple life. It a regular Sunday afternoon event for the people of Bryers DeSantis and SHERIFF DAN PATTERSON (50s) stone faced and rugged -- sit at a corner table, away from most of the cr Also sitting with them is DEPUTY BILLY BRACKEN (20s) a sh and thin but fierce looking young man with a menacing sta and something to prove. DeSantis hands The Sheriff a mani folder.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: This is a missing personвЂ™s report filed by The GoldвЂ™s in November of 1996. After week four and no contact was made, Darcy was presumed dead. A little under two weeks later...she shows up back at home. The Sheriff turns his attention from the paperwork to DeSantis. He squints in confusion. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) Turns out she was staying with a girlfriend and her brother at his place. Some secluded cabin in the woods, 40 miles up state. At the time of her disappearance, her parents were in the middle of an ugly divorce. Darcy admitted to me that she used this as a ploy to keep her parents together.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Why didnвЂ™t the Golds mention any of this before?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: They probably donвЂ™t want the past drudged up any more than I do. Being that Mr. and Mrs. Gold were still contract players for NBC, the whole incident became a huge media case. Sheriff, what IвЂ™m asking is this. I was hoping...for now...we could keep this incident quiet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Sheriff stares over at Deputy Bracken who watches wit equal suspicion. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) You know if word of this leaks, your town is flooded with reporters. If her kidnapper is continuing to make contact with you, odds are heвЂ™s still here. I think a media presence would only scare this guy off. But I know you already know that, Sheriff. Otherwise you wouldвЂ™ve called the state police and FBI the moment Darcy was picked up. The Sheriff cracks a smile -- SMIRKS at the young detecti HeвЂ™s blown away by his up front, in-your-face directnes DeSantis is a force to be reckoned with. Whether the Sher likes it or not.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Anything else, Detective? Deputy Bracken lets out a SMIRK as he devours another sli of the pie. DeSantis pays the Deputy no mind and stays focused on the SheriffвЂ™s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™d like permission to stick around. Review your case files. Talk to any witnesses you may have questioned. You have a sketch of this man. IвЂ™d like to help show his picture around. See if we can pinpoint who this man is. IвЂ™d like to make myself useful, Sheriff. Sheriff Patterson sighs in frustration. He sits, staring DeSantis with uncertainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Patterson and DeSantis take a stroll down a sidew in front of his home. Children are still running about.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Since your friend disappeared, IвЂ™ve been flooded with phone calls. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ll.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SHERIFF PATTERSON (cont'd) People are coming in off the street asking questions about a kidnapping I donвЂ™t have any answers to. Like you said, the only good lead we have is the fact this manвЂ™s Maintained contact. Until we get something better, I donвЂ™t wanna draw any more attention than I have to.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: That includes flashing an LA badge and making everyone even more nervous. Next thing you know...the whole townвЂ™s calling. Asking questions. Wanting to know if thereвЂ™s some crazy bastard out there abducting girls. DarcyвЂ™s friends, The Golds, they donвЂ™t wanna believe sheвЂ™s gone. Sheriff Patterson stops in his tracks -- faces DeSantis. SHERIFF PATTERSON (CONTвЂ™D) Maybe they think youвЂ™1l tell them something different. Something theyвЂ™d rather hear. You say you wanna help?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Whatever I can.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: You keep them calm and out of my hair so me and my men can do our jobs. INT. CASEY AND LEANNEвЂ™S MOTEL ROOM At a corner table. DeSantis sits across from CASEY BRENNE (20s) dark hair, as beautiful as Darcy. Sitting on the edge of a nearby bed is DarcyвЂ™s other fr LEANNE BOWMAN (20s) red hair, cute. Sheriff Patterson leans his back comfortably against the wall, listening in on the conversation. He remains silent and passive despite his obvious disgust with DeSantis. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: He called twice. Yesterday and today.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: At what time did you get the first call?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Real early. IвЂ™d say around five in the morning or so. Maybe Five thirty.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: What did he have to say?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: He just wanted to let us know what a great time he and Darcy were having. Then he said whatever you do, donвЂ™t leave your room for the next few days. Either him or Darcy would be calling back.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Did you ask to speak with Darcy?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: He said she couldnвЂ™t come to the phone. She was in the shower. Getting cleaned up from their long, hot night. He was disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: And what about this second call?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: He didnвЂ™t call again until today...a little bit after two oвЂ™clock. This time Sheriff Patterson was here. DeSantis notices Sheriff Patterson leaning on the wall. T two men exchange stares. CASEY (CONTвЂ™D) He didnвЂ™t say anything about Darcy. He just asked if I spoke with the police. He said he had a message for them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: A message?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: When I told him The Sheriff was here and wanted to talk, he hung up. I guess he panicked. ThatвЂ™s when I called you. Darcy said to call you if I ever needed help.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You did good, Casey. (to Sheriff) Sheriff? You think I could have a few minutes with the girls? Sheriff Patterson gives DeSantis an angry stare, but Maintains his cool composure.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m gonna check on The Golds. He continues out.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Casey -- when we spoke the other day, you mentioned that Darcy was drinking a lot the night she disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yes she was. We all were. So what?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Do you know if DarcyвЂ™s been in any kind of trouble lately? Like with her drugs? Has she been depressed at all? Leanne visibly grows suspicious of the detectiveвЂ™s questioning. As does Casey.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™re you saying?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Before The Sheriff and I can continue any further we need to establish DarcyвЂ™s mind set at the time of her abduction. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Casey seems to be growing impatient with the detectiveвЂ™ of questioning.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: What the hell does her mood have to do with anything? She was picked up in broad daylight in front of two witnesses. WhatвЂ™s your problem?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I know youвЂ™re both scared of the publicity Darcy would get if this thing went public. We all know this isnвЂ™t the first time sheвЂ™s disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s bullshit. That was eight years ago. She was just a kid. I canвЂ™t even believe youвЂ™re bringing that up now. (to Casey) Please tell him heвЂ™s crazy. Casey is awkwardly silent -- refusing to take sides with Leanne. SheвЂ™s already contemplated this. LEANNE (CONTвЂ™D) Casey? Leanne awaits an answer and doesnвЂ™t get one. She sits i state of total dismay and utter disgust, folding her arms looking away in protest.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: She jumped in a strange car although the two of you strongly advised against it. When the Feds get wind of this, theyвЂ™re gonna find this behavior a little suspicious. Especially with her history of running away. Leanne sighs, completely disgusted. She buries her face, unable to even look at the detective. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) The reality is, if we canвЂ™t get her back soon, this will go public. That means FBI. A statewide APB. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) Her face all over the news and on every paper and tabloid that canвЂ™t wait to use this incident to dig up her past and use it against her.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: But she didnвЂ™t run away! She was kidnapped!

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I know she was. But in order for me to find out exactly what happened to Darcy, IвЂ™m gonna need all the facts. I need to know if she was back on her pills. If she was drinking again. If she was having problems at work or with her love life. Anything and everything. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a typical beautiful sunny day in California as DARC GOLD (20s) blonde hair, drop dead gorgeous, jogs down a sidewalk in her quiet, up scale neighborhood. She moves w the grace and confidence of a born star.

dialogues.speaker: TWO WEEKS AGO
dialogues.text: Darcey finishes her jog and continues into her apartment building. INT. DARCYвЂ™S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS Darcy enters and continues into the kitchen. She grabs a bottled water from the refrigerator and begins chugging i down like a mad woman.

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Darcy is sprawled out on the living room floor, stretchin her legs out after a long, hard jog. She is in a full spl The PHONE RINGS behind her. Darcy attempts to grab the ph from the table, but her hand cannot reach. She quickly si up, answers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy sits across from her boss ALICIA NEWMAN (50s) a ver attractive but somewhat frigid woman. She is the creator executive producer of вЂњBeverly ManorвЂќ. One of the top dramas of the last ten years. She is a very important wom and she knows it.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry to call you in here like this. ItвЂ™s been a long week. And a stressful one at that.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: What is it you wanna talk about?

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™ve been making provisions to re- write JenniferвЂ™s character back into the show. WeвЂ™re gonna be bringing her back for next season.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t understand. DidnвЂ™t we kill her off?

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, but the fans miss her. They miss her a lot.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I know. It takes time for any show when they lose a cast member to --

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: (interrupting) No. IвЂ™m afraid our problem runs a bit deeper than that. (abruptly changing the subject) How rude of me. Would you like a drink, Darcy? Darcy sits awkwardly silent -- anxious and uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Umm. Sure. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ms. Newman gives Darcy an unsure grin and briskly walks t corner liquor cabinet. She pours herself and Darcy a shot scotch. She gives Darcy an extra generous belt of the liquor. Darcy notices this and becomes visibly worried.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™ve had a thirty percent drop in ratings since last season. The network feels itвЂ™s because of JenniferвЂ™s absence. Quite frankly, they donвЂ™t feel we can last another season without her. The competition is just too stiff. Ms. Newman hands Darcy her drink and has a seat on the ed of her desk.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Did she say something to you about coming back?

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: No. But I donвЂ™t think that will be a problem. Her new program hasnвЂ™t taken off the way we expected. ThereвЂ™s already talks of a mid season replacement. She can easily make the transition back to Beverly Manor. Make a surprise appearance on the season finale...and our ratings will go through the roof.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: A surprise appearance? But we already wrapped for this season.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re gonna be re-shooting this seasonвЂ™s last two episodes. ItвЂ™s the majority opinion that in order to get us back in the race, our last episode should be more of a cliff hanger. Something that will wet the viewerвЂ™s appetite. Make them wanna tune in for another season. The producers feel with focusing the story line on Jennifer, it could be our best year ever. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: It seems the only logical way of bringing Jennifer back this season is if she exacts her much-awaited revenge on Kristen. Unfortunately, that would mean --

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (interrupting) That would mean killing me off.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a ratings war, Darcy. And we're losing fast. In the end, it all comes down to the numbers. INT. STAIRWAY - DARCYвЂ™S APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY Darcy begins up a flight of stairs with a large bag of groceries, looking completely disgusted. Her annoying neighbor MICHAEL (20s) boyishly handsome, but a bit cocky looks over a railing and notices her coming up the stairs

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Darcy. Darcy SIGHS in frustration -- continuing up the steps tow her neighbor. Michael meets her half-way. His cocky smile ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Funny running into you like this. You coming up the steps just as IвЂ™m leaving.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: And how did I know IвЂ™d be running into you today?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: So youвЂ™ve been thinking about me? Darcy fights back a smile and looks away in embarrassment MICHAEL (CONTвЂ™D) YouвЂ™re blushing.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t blush. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re red as a beet.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m having a hot flash. Now excuse me. I have ice cream melting.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I wonвЂ™t keep you. I was just wondering if youвЂ™d had time to re- think my offer for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I have.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: So what did you decide?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I haven't. Darcy passes Michael and continues up.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Okay. I can see I got you at a bad time. If you change your mind --

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I know where you live. Darcy disappears around a corner, out of sight. INT. DARCYвЂ™S APARTMENT - DUSK The BRIGHT SUN peaks itself through DarcyвЂ™s blinds and her living room. Darcy is sprawled out on the couch, asleep. On the table front of her sits a GIN AND TONIC and a half-empty bottle Her PHONE RINGS. This startles Darcy, causing her to jump She lets the phone ring, eventually letting the answering Machine pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Darcy? ItвЂ™s your mother. Are you there? Hello? Darcy reaches for the phone, answers.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Hi, mom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Darcy? Are you all right? You sound like you were sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I was. So whatвЂ™s up?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just checking to see if youвЂ™re still coming to dinner. Your fatherвЂ™s expecting you, you know? Darcy quickly wakes herself. Sits up.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Oh, man. What time is it? She checks her watch and grabs her head in pain from sitt up too fast. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s quarter tillвЂ™ six. WhatвЂ™s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Nothing. I have a headache.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh. So are you still coming?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. IвЂ™ve kind of had a bad day.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a long, complicated story. One I really donвЂ™t wanna get into right now.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well it sounds to me like the last thing you should do is be alone right now. Why donвЂ™t you get dressed and come over. We can talk about it before dinner. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Okay. See you in a little bit. Darcy hangs up. She lets out a huge, unenthusiastic sigh exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GoldвЂ™s upper middle class home. Darcy definitely en a comfortable but humble childhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy and her two parents HENRY GOLD (50s) and SHARON GOL (50s) sit at the dinner table devouring a large home-cook meal. Fried chicken, mashed potatoes, corn on the cob, et

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: So whatвЂ™s the big deal? I thought you liked Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I do. I guess.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: So whatвЂ™s the problem? I think itвЂ™1l be good for the show if she came back. Especially for your character.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: I think DarcyвЂ™s concerned there might not be room for both of them on the show.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Hey, Darcy. YouвЂ™ve got no reason to be upset about this. SheвЂ™s been on that program for seven years. ItвЂ™s only your first season. You canвЂ™t just expect to win over her fans just like that. YouвЂ™1l have to give them time to develop your character. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Darcy puts down her fork and nervously folds her arms. Sh canвЂ™t even look her father in the eye, let alone tell h real truth. MR. GOLD (CONTвЂ™D) But all that doesnвЂ™t matter. What matters is your mother and I are proud of you. YouвЂ™ve accomplished a lot this year. I know we havenвЂ™t exactly been supportive. But you surprised the hell out of a lot of people by staying sober the way you have. You should be proud of yourself. Just like we are. Darcy looks anything but proud.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s right, Darcy. Mrs. Gold notices DarcyвЂ™s strange demeanor. MRS. GOLD (CONTвЂ™D) Honey? Is there something youвЂ™re not telling us? You donвЂ™t look so hot. Darcy pauses -- contemplates telling her parents she was go from the show, but eventually backs down.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: No. I guess IвЂ™m just not that hungry.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Listen to your father. DonвЂ™t let Jennifer Conway get you down. YouвЂ™re a winner. ItвЂ™s in your blood. YouвЂ™re just gonna have to get used to it. Darcy sports a fake smile and scoops herself some mashed potatoes. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: INT. DARCYвЂ™S APARTMENT BUILDING - PARKING GARAGE - NIGH DARCY pulls her S8.U.V. into an empty spot.  23. INT. DARCYвЂ™S S.U.V. DarcyвЂ™s face is red and her eyes are filled with tears. shuts off her engine and begins crying heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy continues to cry as she slowly walks through the hallway headed to her apartment. INT. DARCYвЂ™S APARTMENT Darcy enters -- shuts the door behind her. She rests her back against the door, slowly sliding to the floor and balling like crazy. INT. MICHAELвЂ™S APARTMENT - MINUTES LATER Michael is in bed, asleep. He hears a LOUD KNOCKING comin from the other room. He quickly gets up, tosses on a robe and continues to the door. He answers and is in shock to DARCY standing before him. Her makeup is a mess from crying. She stands silent and still. Michael finally breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s 11:30. A little late for dinner, donвЂ™t you think? Darcy invites herself inside -- still crying. She begins kissing Michael. He is taken back at first, but doesnвЂ™t her. She takes off his robe and begins kissing his bare chest -- forcing him against a wall as they continue.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: INT. MICHAELвЂ™S BEDROOM - SOME TIME LATER Darcy checks to see if Michael is awake. She quietly snea out of bed. Michael is almost comatose. He doesnвЂ™t even move let alone notice Darcy.  24. INT. DARCYвЂ™S APARTMENT - NIGHT Darcy enters. She is completely disheveled and seemingly upset at herself for what sheвЂ™s done with Michael. She tosses her keys down on a corner table as a long, complic day is coming to an end.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Darcy sits alone in the dark, drinking a gin and tonic an talking on the phone with Casey.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Did I wake you?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s okay. WhatвЂ™s up?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just wanted to talk.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, right, Darcy. ItвЂ™s one oвЂ™clock in the morning. WhatвЂ™s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Umm...do you wanna get out of here? Maybe go somewhere this weekend? cur TO: INT. CASEY AND LEANNEвЂ™S MOTEL ROOM - DAY

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: And thatвЂ™s pretty much it.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: And you donвЂ™t know anything else?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: No. But I could tell something was wrong by the way she was acting. I could hear her crying. When I asked what it was, she wouldnвЂ™t tell me. It was obvious she didnвЂ™t feel like talking about it, so I didnвЂ™t push. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: But she did tell you she lost her job and slept with Michael?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: No. Wot then. I didnвЂ™t hear about that until later. But I knew she had a bad day. You could tell she just wanted to get the hell out of LA as soon as possible. She suggested we go to her parentвЂ™s lodge in Park City for the weekend. DeSantis jots down a few notes on a note pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DarcyвЂ™s S.U.V. barrels down the empty highway. Surround BRIGHT RED LANDSCAPE. In the b.g., we hear LOUD MUSIC PLAYING from the interior of the truck. INT. S.U.V. Darcy is behind the wheel with Casey up front and Leanne the back.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: So, Darcy. I hear youвЂ™re living across the hall from Hannibal Lector. Darcy doesnвЂ™t respond. She simply stares over at Casey disgust.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Sorry. I had to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: So whatвЂ™s his problem anyway? Is he, like, leaving dead flowers on your doorstep and writing you poems in his own blood?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s not like that. HeвЂ™s harmless. HeвЂ™s an actor and heвЂ™s new in the building. HeвЂ™s just a little star struck. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
DARCY (cont'd) Once he finds out IвЂ™m out of a job, heвЂ™1ll get over it. Believe me.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Casey said that you said he was stalking you or something.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Was stalking her. Not anymore. (to Darcy) IsnвЂ™t that right, Darcy? Darcy smacks Casey on the arm. LeanneвЂ™s jaw drops as sh slowly figures it out.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: You slept with him?! You little skank!

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: It was a mistake. (to Casey) Why did you even do that?

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. You could tell her you porked some weird stalker guy you barely even know, but you canвЂ™t tell me?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Maybe itвЂ™s because I know youвЂ™d freak out and call me pretty names like ho-bag and skank.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Well, IвЂ™m sorry, Darcy, but IвЂ™m not the one whoвЂ™s constantly breaking our pact.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: A pact? ThereвЂ™s a pact?

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Darcey and I decided that the next relationship we were in, we were gonna hold out on our man for at least three months. The idea being that any man that can last three months is in it for more than sex.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Or heвЂ™s really lame and desperate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Oh. So now I go with desperate guys? Is that it? That the only guy who could possibly be interested in LeanneвЂ™s sagginвЂ™ tits is some reject who hasnвЂ™t been laid in five years? Please, Darcy. DonвЂ™t feel the need to spare my feelings or anything. Just come out with it.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (to Leanne) Oh, yeah. While weвЂ™re on the subject. WhoвЂ™s pregnancy test did I find in your waste basket last week?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Busted! Now whoвЂ™s the skank?

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Okay. First of all, that wasnвЂ™t mine.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: It wasnвЂ™t mine! I know it wasnвЂ™t DarcyвЂ™s, so who else could it be?

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: If youвЂ™d shut up a second, I could tell you, Casey!

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Okay, fine. Tell us. WeвЂ™re all ears. Darcy breaks out in hysterics. LEANNE (CONTвЂ™D) I had a friend over. She lives with her folks. She was too afraid to do it at home so she used our place.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, right, Leanne. YouвЂ™re so busted. Darcy continues laughing uncontrollably. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: (to both) WhatвЂ™re you guys?...like a tag team or something? (to Casey) IвЂ™m trying to talk to Darcy for a second. IвЂ™m trying to make a point and youвЂ™re, like, re-directing everything at me. Getting all in my face.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: And how many times exactly did you and Roger go out before he climbed the great peaks of Mount Leanne?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, really. It couldnвЂ™t have been more than twice.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it was over a span of three months, so that doesnвЂ™t count. Darcy and Casey continue laughing at Leanne. LEANNE (CONTвЂ™D) It doesnвЂ™t count!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach an old worn down gas station and turn in -- parking in front of one of the pumps. Out steps Darcy and the two girls. Darcy continues into the store.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Great going, Leanne. I shouldвЂ™ve known better than to tell you anything.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: What? IвЂ™m bored. Nobody said anything for, like, two hours. I was just trying to liven things up a bit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Well you did. WhyвЂ™d you have to say anything about her neighbor? DarcyвЂ™s never gonna tell me anything again.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Hey, IвЂ™m sorry, but I tell you guys everything and... Leanne stops mid-sentence when she notices a suspicious M (30s) blocking Darcy from entering the convenience store. is being very flirtatious, forcing himself on her. He is typical red-neck cowboy with a full beard, tank-top, dark shades and cowboy hat.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: That cowboy wonвЂ™t let Darcy inside. Casey also turns her attention to the door. The cowboy stands, blocking Darcy from the doorway. Casey begins filling DarcyвЂ™s tank, all the while watchi greasy cowboy as he continues to taunt Darcy.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (to herself) Just kick him in the balls, Darcy. The cowboy finally gives up and lets Darcy pass. He continues to his truck...A GREY DODGE PICK-UP sitting at far end of the lot. Casey watches the mysterious man as he returns her stare. grins and points his finger at her, all the while holding bottle of beer in the same hand. He flicks his thumb as i heвЂ™s pulling an imaginary trigger. Casey is visibly frightened by this. The cowboy crawls in his truck, cranks up the engine. He sits, waiting, staring back at the girls in his rearview mirror. Darcy coming out of the store. Casey hangs up the pump as she and Leanne get back in the truck. Darcy follows behind.  30. INT. S.U.V. Casey and Leanne stare into DarcyвЂ™s rearview mirror, ga at the dirty pick-up in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Nice wheels. Casey turns her attention to Darcy who is seemingly upset

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Same ass holes, different state.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Some things you canвЂ™t get away from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls pull out of the small lot and back onto the highway. They continue down the road a piece -- the grey pick-up follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three girls sit bellied up at the local bar, doing sh of tequila. Darcy is the ring leader, setting the other two up with another shot.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Raise your glasses. The three girls prepare for a toast. DARCY (CONTвЂ™D) HereвЂ™s to Jennifer. For her triumphant, but all too soon return to Beverly Manor.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Here, here. I guess. The three girls tap glasses -- about to throw down anothe shot, until -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Wait. Casey and Darcy stare over at Leanne, waiting. LEANNE (CONTвЂ™D) The other day, didnвЂ™t you say you wanted to claw this chickвЂ™s eyes out and smash her face with a brick? Casey checks with Darcy.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: So maybe it isnвЂ™t the most sincere of toasts. IвЂ™m just trying to bea good sport. (changing the subject) Okay. For real this time. All joking aside. HereвЂ™s to my mother and father, Henry and Sharon Gold. May their love only grow stronger in these very difficult days that lay ahead. Leanne looks over at Casey who returns her stare. They ar both suspicious of DarcyвЂ™s strange rhetoric. The three tap glasses, throw back another shot.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: (to Darcy) Why donвЂ™t you ease up a bit. DonвЂ™t you think youвЂ™re hitting the booze a little hard?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Yes I do. On that note, I think IвЂ™ll have another. Darcy pours herself another shot of Cuervo. DARCY (CONTвЂ™D) Are you gonna have one with me or you gonna be a pain in my ass this whole trip? Casey gives up and holds out her glass to Darcy who quick fills it. Leanne turns her attention to the front door and notices COWBOY from earlier. He struts over to the bar and bellie up. The bartender takes his order. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Oh great. DonвЂ™t look now. Casey and Darcy notice him sitting down just a few feet a They watch as he whispers something to the bartender. The bartender smiles and approaches the girls.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Excuse me ladies. The gentleman at the end of the bar will be taking care of your tab this evening.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Tell him no thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Tell him we appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Darcy?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Let him pay. Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t want him hassling us again.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: He didnвЂ™t hassle you, he hassled me. If I wanna be hassled, thatвЂ™s my problem.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re drinking too much.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: No. YouвЂ™re just drinking too little.

dialogues.speaker: SOME TIME LATER
dialogues.text: Darcy and the cowboy are dancing. Darcy is absolutely obliterated. Out of her mind drunk. She is hanging all ov the cowboy and making a fool of herself. Casey and Leanne sit at a corner table, way passed ready leave.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Do you think we should say something to her? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEANNE (cont'd) I mean, if sheвЂ™s not careful sheвЂ™s gonna throw up all over his shirt. Just like at that club last month. Casey squints a bit, confused.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Darcy said that was you.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Whatever. Can we just go get her and leave? Casey reluctantly takes the job and walks over to Darcy a her dance partner.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. We have to go.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Oh, do we have to? Casey grabs her friend by the arm and pulls her away from cowboy. They continue out of the bar as Leanne follows behind.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (to cowboy) Bye, bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy is puking her guts up in the toilet as Leanne holds hair back. Casey walks in with a few cans of ginger ale. She pours o into a small cup of ice and rests it on a nearby sink.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: HowвЂ™s she doing?

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: You wanna turn down her bed. IвЂ™m gonna try to move her. Casey steps out -- back into the bedroom. Darcy tosses a more chunks into the commode. Leanne takes a peek inside. LEANNE (CONTвЂ™D) God. What is that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Casey turns down the sheets on one of the two beds. She looks up and notices A MAN -- WEARING A DARK SKI MASK AND BLACK COWBOY HAT -- staring into the window, between the drapes and into their room. He quickly backs away.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Leanne? Casey slowly moves to the door and locks it. She hurries the window and peeks outside. There is no one in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The S.U.V. is back on the road as the three girls continu their journey across the red desert. INT. S.U.V.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: My stomach is killing me.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You need some coffee and dry toast. Soak up some of that poison in your system.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s a diner about a quarter mile up the road. My dad used to stop there all the time for breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Oh, God. Remind me again why I drink tequila. ThereвЂ™s got to be an easier way to have fun. Darcy looks to her right, quickly taking notice of someth DARCYвЂ™S P.O.V. They pass by a mysterious BLUE STATION WAGON sitting on t side of the road. The driverвЂ™s side window is down and manвЂ™s head sits rested against the side of the door. He isnвЂ™t moving. There is BLOOD in the manвЂ™s hair and on door. They continue past the car.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Wait. Go back.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What? Did you forget something?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: No. Back there in that car. I saw someone. They were bleeding and they werenвЂ™t moving!

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t see anything.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I did! And he was bleeding! Look! Somebody could be hurt! Now will you just go back!

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: I saw something too, Casey. Maybe we should check it out.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? WeвЂ™re in the middle of nowhere. You donвЂ™t know that guy. He could have a gun or something. He could stuff the three of us in his trunk.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s my truck and IвЂ™m telling you to turn around right now!

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: No way, Darcy! Forget it! Darcey forcefully grabs the wheel, jerking it to the righ forcing them onto the soft shoulder. Casey quickly steps the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What the fuck, Darcy! What the hellвЂ™s the matter with you?! Are you high?!

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Turn around right now or get out of the truck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Casey looks in the rearview mirror, staring back at Leann The two girls sharing a look of shock and confusion. Case turns back to Darcy.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Alright, Darcy. WeвЂ™ll go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey pulls a quick u-turn and heads back toward the idle car. The S.U.V. pulls up about a hundred feet behind the and slowly comes to a halt. INT. S.U.V.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: With pleasure. Darcy steps out and begins toward the vehicle. Casey and Leanne watch as Darcy gets closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy stops and peeks through the rear windshield at the behind the wheel. He isnвЂ™t moving. She continues toward car -- her pace a bit slower and more cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the interior of the car, we look up at Darcy as she approaches the passenger side door and peeks inside. She visibly startled by something and steps back a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy stares back at her two friends. INT. S.U.V. Casey and Leanne both watch as Darcy stares back at them a panicked look in her eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: What is it? What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: He isnвЂ™t moving! IвЂ™m gonna check his pulse! INT. S.U.V. Casey nervously strokes her hair back.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Now would be a good time to go get her.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Let me guess. You want me to do it?

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Well, youвЂ™re closer. Casey smirks at Leanne, shakes her head and steps out. INT./EXT. S.U.V. Casey slowly steps out of the truck and begins toward Dar and the station wagon.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Darcy!

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s blood all over the place! I think he might be dead!

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Then letвЂ™s call an ambulance and get the hell out of here! Darcy peeks through the rear passenger window and into th backseat. Something catches her attention. DARCYвЂ™S P.O.V. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The manвЂ™s wallet sits opened on the backseat. Credit ca and wallet sized photographs are scattered all over the place. It appears someone has stolen his money. INT./EXT. S.U.V. Leanne watches as Darcy opens the rear passenger side doo

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: What the hell is she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey continues toward the car at a brisk pace.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Darcy, IвЂ™m serious! LetвЂ™s go! Darcy crawls into the backseat, against the advisement of friend. She has to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy picks up the wallet from the seat. She opens it and notices that it is completely empty. No loose cash, no nothing. Suddenly...THE MAN BEHIND THE WHEEL sits up and strikes Darcy over the head, knocking her backward. He starts the engine and darts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey watches in horror.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: The car spins out of the dirt and back onto the main road INT. S.U.V. Leanne also watches in horror as the station wagon speeds down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey chases after the car on foot as a panicked Darcy sm her hands on the rear windshield and SCREAMS for help. He screams are silent: muffled by the glass.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: Jumps from the car and yells for Casey to return.

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: Leanne jumps in the driverвЂ™s seat. Casey runs back and jumps in the front passenger seat. Th two girls quickly begin after the car, in full pursuit. INT. S.U.V.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: DONвЂ™T YOU LOSE HER!!!

dialogues.speaker: CALL THE POLICE
dialogues.text: Casey is in an absolute panic as she pulls out her cell p and dials 9-1-1.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: The phoneвЂ™s not working! They gain on DarcyвЂ™s kidnapper but quickly begin to slo down. Leanne hits the gas repeatedly, but seems to do no good. The car keeps getting slower and slower. Soon, stepping on the gas has no effect at all. Leanne looks down at the gauge. The tank is empty.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: What the hell!

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: WeвЂ™re losing him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The S.U.V. comes to a complete halt on the side of the ro (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MOMENTS PASS
dialogues.text: Then suddenly...a frantic Casey and Leanne jump out of th truck and head up the road on foot -- running as fast as can. They are headed for a small DINER in the near distan A pay phone awaits them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey and Leanne approach the diner, completely exhausted Casey runs to a pay phone and dials 9-1-1.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: 911. WhatвЂ™s your emergency? cuT TO: INT. CASEY AND LEANNEвЂ™S MOTEL ROOM - DAY

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: And that was the last we saw of her.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Neither this grey pick-up or the wagon had a license tag?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: So what do you think? You think it was the same guy? DeSantis nods in agreement. cuUT TO: INT. SHERIFF PATTERSONвЂ™S CAR - DAY Sheriff Patterson and DeSantis cruise down a dusty piece highway, side by side.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I hear this isnвЂ™t the first time a womanвЂ™s been abducted in Bryerson. Sheriff Patterson smiles at DeSantisвЂ™s coy persistence. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: So you heard about that did you?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You wanna tell me about Janet Cooney?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Not much to tell. She was this hooker. Drifted in to town some years back. She was out there on the highway, sellinвЂ™ her ass for about two years. One night, some john picks her up, beats her damn near to death, then drops her in the desert right where he found her.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: No leads?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: No. SheвЂ™s got no known family. We couldnвЂ™t get anyone to claim the body. After the autopsy, we had her cremated. Outside her occupation, no one seems to know much about her.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: So whatвЂ™s your take on what happened? Sheriff Patterson stares suspiciously over at DeSantis. Reluctant to answer.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: We found a switchblade in the dirt near CooneyвЂ™s body, covered in blood. Her right thumb and finger were sliced up real good. Examiner said she cut herself with the blade. So IвЂ™m thinking, he starts getting rough with her so she pulls the knife. DeSantis going over the case in his head and comparing hi theories with the Sheriff. SHERIFF PATTERSON (CONTвЂ™D) He tries to knock the knife out of her hand and she cuts herself. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF PATTERSON (CONTвЂ™D) Then he starts in on beating her. Only he donвЂ™t stop. When heвЂ™s done, he drags her into the desert and off he goes into the sweet bye and bye.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: What about the possibility this guyвЂ™s local?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t think so. Her house was only a quarter mile up the road from where we found her. ThatвЂ™s where she usually took her johns. I think this guy wanted a quickie for the road. Besides. A local knows about a thousand better hiding places for that body than on the side of the highway in plain view. No. This guy was ina panic.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: That would be true. Unless he wanted you to find her body. Sheriff Patterson turns and gives DeSantis a discerning stare.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: I know what youвЂ™re getting at. Now just in case youвЂ™re thinking thereвЂ™s a connection between the Cooney murder and your girl getting snatched, you can hold it right there.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t say that.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: No, but youвЂ™re hinting at it. IвЂ™m not as slow as you think, DeSantis.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You got a small town, Sheriff. I wouldnвЂ™t think this type of thing happens every day.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: No, it doesnвЂ™t. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: And you donвЂ™t think thereвЂ™s a possibility of a connection?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: I watched that girl for years, peddling her ass on that highway. It was a matter of time before some nut job passing through town broke her neck or cut her throat. The last thing I wanna do is scream serial killer and get everyone in town into an uproar. TheyвЂ™ll be burning up my phone line every time little SusieвЂ™s late getting home from cheerleading. DeSantis visibly grows weary of Sheriff PattersonвЂ™s unc lazy attitude.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: This isnвЂ™t LA. ItвЂ™s peaceful here. For the last twenty years these people have been looking to me to keep it that way. If word gets out IвЂ™m losing control, then all hell breaks loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a door being unlocked. Enter DeSantis and Sheriff Patterson. The first thing DeSantis notices are t MINUTE DROPS OF BLOOD on the carpet, leading into the bathroom. HIS P.O.V. DeSantis looks into the bathroom and instantly notices th BLOODY HANDPRINT on the interior wall of the shower. (No shower curtain)

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The two men continue further into the room. DeSantis take notice of the barren hook on the wall where a picture onc hung.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: I figured they started fighting right about here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sheriff Patterson stands near the center of the room wher the picture fell from the wall. DeSantis notices small pieces of broken glass and a BLOOD RIGHT HANDPRINT. The small print of a young woman. SHERIFF PATTERSON (CONTвЂ™D) Looks like they started fighting, he throws her into the wall, knocking the picture down and shattering the frame. ThatвЂ™s probably where she cut herself. She falls right about here and bleeds out. DeSantis turns his attention from the bloody spot to yet another BLOOD STAIN about ten feet away. A good foot from that stain are TWO MORE BLOODY HANDPRINTS. The prints are small and delicate. He approaches the blood evidence, kneels down to take a closer look. In the corner of the room sits a small round table. There a small BLOOD SMEAR on the edge of the table. DeSantis then motions toward the BLOOD STAIN and HANDPRIN on the carpet -- connecting all the dots in his head. He stands and motions toward the bed. The blankets are turned down on only half of the bed, as if only one perso has slept in it.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You get the lab results from forensics?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Yeah. They pulled a blonde hair from the bed sheets and crossed it with a sample from DarcyвЂ™s hair brush. Wo match. DeSantis stays focused on the crime scene, completely ignoring Sheriff Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DeSantis kneels over the bathtub, takes a peek. Sheriff Patterson hovers behind him. DeSantis notices the prints THREE BLOODY FINGERTIPS on the edge of the tub.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: You notice anything missing?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: The shower curtain.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: He used it to wrap the body.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s three print smears on the edge of the tub, plus the handprint. But the rest of the showerвЂ™s immaculate. ItвЂ™s like he cleaned around it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Looks like she regained consciousness and tried to get out.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s wrong with this picture?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: The handprint. ItвЂ™s too high up the wall. If your girl were flat on her back, thereвЂ™s no way sheвЂ™d reach.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Very good, Sheriff, but what does it mean? INT. SHERIFF PATTERSONвЂ™S HOME - OFFICE - NIGHT DeSantis sifts through a stack of CRIME SCENE PHOTOS from both the Janet Cooney murder and the motel room where Dar was assaulted. Sheriff Patterson sits comfortably with hi feet kicked up on a desk, waiting for DeSantis to finish.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know what you think youвЂ™re gonna find, but weвЂ™ve been over every inch of those things a thousand times. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: It never hurts to have a fresh pair of eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Look. If I donвЂ™t get to bed, my wifeвЂ™s gonna come looking for me. DeSantis picks up a large PHOTO OF JANET COONEYвЂ™S BODY the desk. It is a FULL SHOT of her body, laying idle in t desert. Her LEFT ARM lay fully extended and exposed. Her RIGHT ARM is carefully place behind her back. He lays the picture down and reviews the next; a CLOSE UP the deceasedвЂ™s LEFT HAND. There are severe cuts on the womanвЂ™s thumb and index finger. Self-inflicted wounds c by a switchblade.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: What? DeSantis picks up another CRIME SCENE PHOTO from the desk the BLOODY HANDPRINT of DarcyвЂ™s LEFT HAND on the shower He lays the photo down and picks up another; a shot of another BLOODY HANDPRINT on the motel roomвЂ™s carpet. Da wounded RIGHT HAND after she is violently tossed to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s only one print on the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: If Darcy cut both her hands on the glass, then why is there only a right hand print on the carpet?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Simple. Her left hand never touched the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Maybe. Or someone else cut it for her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™re you saying? DeSantis tosses down a photo and picks up another. This o is a CLOSE UP of CooneyвЂ™s RIGHT ARM, placed carefully b her back.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: CooneyвЂ™s arm was found behind her back. I donвЂ™t think this was coincidence. This is how your guy restrained her. She didnвЂ™t die in that car. Your guy walked her into the desert first. The wheels begin to turn in Sheriff PattersonвЂ™s eyes. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) Then he wraps her arm around her back and listens to her scream in pain as she begs for her life. You know what else? I think he did the same thing to Darcy.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Now hold on. DonвЂ™t you think youвЂ™re getting a little ahead of yourself? All this could be coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s why the left hand print. He pulls DarcyвЂ™s arm around her back. Just like he did to Cooney. ThatвЂ™s when he cut her. He cuts her left hand and plants her print on the shower wall. DeSantis picks up the photo of CooneyвЂ™s LEFT HAND, seve wounded from a knife. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) DarcyвЂ™s left hand print. ThatвЂ™s what he wanted us to find. ThatвЂ™s the connection.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Find what? And what connection? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I think I know what this guy was trying to tell you now, Sheriff. Come and get me, cop. INT. SHERIFFвЂ™S DEPARTMENT - CONFERENCE ROOM - DAY DeSantis, Sheriff Patterson and The Golds sit at a large conference table, discussing the investigation. The Golds appear very weary. They look as if theyвЂ™ve be erying non-stop for days.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Has Darcy mentioned anything to you about getting strange phone calls or if someone might be following her?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: If there were someone like that, she wouldnвЂ™t tell us.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: She doesnвЂ™t like to worry us. We've always been very protective with Darcy. When her drugs started getting out of control, we put her in a hospital. When she got out, we insisted she come stay with us for awhile. She didnвЂ™t want any part of it. But the network insisted she stayed under strict supervision those first few months out of the program. SheвЂ™s barely spoken with us since. DeSantis is locked into every word. A look of intense concentration consumes his face.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: She was hell bent on jumping right back into her career. No matter how much we were against it. DeSantis looks to be in deep thought, pondering what The Golds have told him. He snaps out of it and turns his attention back to The Golds.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Thank you.  49. EXT. SHERIFFвЂ™S DEPARTMENT - DAY Mr. Gold takes his dog for a short walk across the parkin lot, leash in hand. Sharon stands in front of the office, puffs away at a cigarette, taking one nervous drag after next as DeSantis exits the building. He spots her, quietl having a seat on an outside bench.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: It really is beautiful country, isnвЂ™t it? DeSantis stares off into the mountains, as if for the fir time.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Yes, it certainly is. I guess I never stopped to notice.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: I forgot how much I missed it here. ItвЂ™s so quiet. Sometimes I wonder if Darcy were better off being raised in a small town. Someplace where people donвЂ™t walk all over you, or spit on you so much as look at you. Sharon nervously reaching for another smoke, sparking it DeSantis noticing her slowly growing angry, almost breaki out into tears. MRS. GOLD (CONTвЂ™D) But we were the typical Hollywood family. Darcy spent most of her childhood either listening to Henry and I argue or watching us drink. Our whole world revolved around the next audition or getting picked up by some stupid pilot. And it was always a competition. We thought our lives would change if we had a baby and stopped thinking about ourselves. But it didnвЂ™t. Nothing ever changed. SharonвЂ™s eyes remain locked on Henry, now tossing a ten ball with his dog. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MRS. GOLD (CONTвЂ™D) Except now, instead of two angry people in the house, there were three. I remember when things got too hot between Henry and me at the dinner table...Darcy would ask if the three of us could go get ice cream. We would always give in. Every time. It seems like every other night, after dinner, we were sitting down at Scoops. Watching each other eat ice cream. None of us saying a damn thing. But it always put a smile on DarcyвЂ™s face. Henry and I would just look at each other, smiling at what a little con artist she was. She was funny that way. Sharon turns, smiling at DeSantis, who politely returns h grin. MRS. GOLD (CONTвЂ™D) I guess she had to have a sense of humor living with the two of us. Imagine our shock when Darcy announced she wanted to be an actress like her mommy. I guess, in a way, sheвЂ™d been performing her whole life. ThatвЂ™s all she ever knew how to do. DeSantis slowly drifts off into a daydream, contemplating what Sharon has told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis cruises down a long, dark stretch of highway. He makes a left turn onto a dirty, country road. He slowly makes his way down the path until he approaches TWO PATRO CARS -- LIGHTS FLASHING. Parked in the middle of the road is the BLUE STATION WAGO from before. The trunk sits open. DeSantis notices and is visibly frightened.  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis steps out and approaches the abandoned car. He i greeted by Sheriff Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Is she...?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: No. But we did find this. Sheriff Patterson walks to the rear of the station wagon motions inside. He grabs one of FIVE LARGE RED GAS CANS f the trunk. They are all filled to the brim with gasoline. SHERIFF PATTERSON (CONTвЂ™D) Looks like he siphoned the gas out of DarcyвЂ™s truck the night before. And so the game continues.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You get a lead on the owner?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: No tags, no registration and not one visible VIN on the entire car.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Take a look for yourself. Sheriff Patterson begins toward the driverвЂ™s side of th vehicle. DeSantis follows behind. Sheriff Patterson motions toward bright RED BLOOD on the outside of the driverвЂ™s door. SHERIFF PATTERSON (CONTвЂ™D) Red paint. ItвЂ™s all over the interior. DeSantis peeks his head inside, taking in the carefully staged crime scene. Fake blood is carefully spattered on steering wheel, headrest, dashboard and windshield.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: So what do you make of this? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: To the untrained eye, like Darcy, this might look a helluva lot like a gunshot wound to the head, close range. DeSantis pulls his head from the window and faces The Sheriff. SHERIFF PATTERSON (CONTвЂ™D) And just when she figures him for dead, she opens the door to check his ID and off he goes.

dialogues.speaker: I.D.
dialogues.text: Sheriff Patterson hands DeSantis a black wallet.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Found it in the backseat along with a mess of stolen credit cards, no cash. The cards were scattered everywhere and the wallet was empty. Your girl probably spotted it in the backseat and got in to get a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a set-up. He makes it so he got shot by some drifter who snagged his cash.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: This guy sure went through a lot of trouble to snatch your girlfriend, DeSantis.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Looks that way. DeSantis brushes off the Sheriff. Sheriff PattersonвЂ™s e never leave the detective. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) If he dumped her, she canвЂ™t be far.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: The dogs are on their way. ItвЂ™ll be sun-up in about an hour. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™1l let The Golds know. DeSantis walks off. Sheriff Patterson watches with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CASEY AND LEANNEвЂ™S MOTEL ROOM - NIGHT The room is dark. DeSantis sits in a corner chair, in dee thought, as Casey and Leanne sleep in the same bed just a feet away. Casey lays awake, focusing on the telephone. Leanne is so asleep.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I keep waiting for that phone to ring. Casey focuses on DeSantisвЂ™ eyes, studying them. CASEY (CONTвЂ™D) You think sheвЂ™s dead, donвЂ™t you? or)

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Me too. DeSantis is visibly surprised with Casey. CASEY (CONTвЂ™D) IвЂ™m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: (motioning to Leanne) HowвЂ™s she handling this?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Leanne? Same way she deals with everything else in her life. She sleeps all day and hopes everything will work out on its own.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: And Darcy? Does she...? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Still talk about you? Drink herself to sleep every night over her unborn child? No. Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s not what I was gonna ask.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: She doesnвЂ™t blame you for losing the baby. It was the stress of everything. Trying to stay straight. Trying to stay perfect in the publicвЂ™s eyes. She hasnвЂ™t been happy for awhile, you know?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Do her parents know about us?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. Darcy never mentioned it. It doesnвЂ™t really matter anymore, does it? The only thing you can do for her now is find her and bring her home alive. After that, the two of you can call it even. INT. MR. AND MRS. GOLDвЂ™S MOTEL ROOM Henry and Sharon lay awake in bed. Sharon in HenryвЂ™s ar searching for some comfort at this very difficult time. Thoughts of their daughterвЂ™s safety consume their every second. The PHONE suddenly RINGS, startling The Golds. Henry reac over and answers.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Hello? No one. MR. GOLD (CONTвЂ™D) Hello? (listens) Who is this? Sharon quickly sits up, putting her ear to the phone and listening for a voice on the other line. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STRANGE MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m watching you. A stunned Sharon covers her mouth to keep from screaming. Suddenly...there is a LOUD KNOCK at the door. The Golds almost jump off the bed in a panic as Sharon lets out a horrible shriek.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Stay here. Mr. Gold reluctantly heads for the front door. He opens a walks outside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gold looks into the distance and notices the strange COWBOY -- black cowboy hat and face mask -- on a DIRT BIK sitting at the edge of the motel parking lot. He is revvi his engine and staring back at Mr. Gold. Mr. Gold simply stands in shock, unsure of his next move. only returns the manвЂ™s stare. He is helpless. Mrs. Gold runs to the doorway and notices something taped the door itself. It is a polaroid of Darcy, streaked in blood. Her throat has apparently been slit. Her lifeless eyes staring back at us. Mrs. Gold instantly turning away from the photo, covering her mouth. She vomits slightly, between her fingers, stumbling to the floor in shock. The cowboy speeds off, down the dark highway, kicking up mound of dirt and dust into the air. Mrs. Gold SCREAMS out in horror. Mr. Gold runs back into room, noticing the picture. He also SCREAMS out in agony this gruesome sight. He grabs his wife and holds her tigh as they grieve for their daughter together. Then, the PHO RINGS again. Mr. Gold rushes over to answer.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This must be daddy.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Yes. This is Henry Gold. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Good. Pay close attention, Henry. Now you know IвЂ™m watching you. That means I see things. When you take your next piss, before you fuck one more inch of that wife of yours, IвЂ™1l know about it. Tell me you understand.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Yeah. I get it. Mrs. Gold hovers over the toilet, dry heaving. She is in complete shock, sick beyond description. Mr. Gold rushes over to her, getting her attention. She stares up at him.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Henry! Mr. Gold shuts his eyes, unable to bear the scene before He quickly turns away from his wife, trying to focus.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now understand this, Henry. If you involve one more cop or step one foot outside this city without my permission...I let the whore die. NowвЂ™s the part where you ask me what I want.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Good boy. I want five hundred thousand cash, not a penny less.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: I...I donвЂ™t know. I donвЂ™t have that kind of money. Be reasonable. I can get you some money, but...

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Now, come on, Henry. Your daughterвЂ™s worth it. I know who she is. ThereвЂ™s a lot of people who wanna see her live. YouвЂ™re in charge of seeing she does. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THE COWBOY (V.0.) (cont'd) When you get the cash, you can contact DarcyвЂ™s cell and IвЂ™1l get you the time and place. You have forty eight hours. Well...youвЂ™re wasting time, Henry. I need a yes or no.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. I can get it.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Good. I like your attitude. YouвЂ™re one step closer to getting your daughter back. Sleep well, Henry. The cowboy hangs up. INT. SHERIFFвЂ™S DEPARTMENT - CONFERENCE ROOM - MORNING DeSantis, The Golds, Casey and Leanne gather around the table as Sheriff Patterson stands at the helm.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: This was only a warning of what heвЂ™1l do to her if we donвЂ™t meet his demands. HeвЂ™s asking for half a million cash. (to The Golds) I assume you and your wife donвЂ™t have that kind of money laying around?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: No. We've got about $100,000 in savings, a few bonds. Nothing close.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: Maybe if we made a good faith payment it could buy us some more time...

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: It wonвЂ™t work. ItвЂ™s got to be $500,000. Not a dime less or he kills Darcy. Now itвЂ™s obvious this man knows who she is and what kind of cash sheвЂ™s capable of raising. HeвЂ™s not looking to settle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: But DarcyвЂ™s just getting started. She doesnвЂ™t have that kind of money.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: But she knows people who do. People who would want to help her. Our guy knows that.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™re you saying?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: The only option we have is going to KBS. I think our guyвЂ™s counting on that.

dialogues.speaker: LEANNE
dialogues.text: The network?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
