dialogues.text: If this goes public and the press finds out they refused to put up DarcyвЂ™s ransom, theyвЂ™1ll have a field day with it. After just letting Darcy out of her contract IвЂ™m sure they wonвЂ™t want any more bad publicity.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t understand. DarcyвЂ™s missing, possibly dead and youвЂ™re talking about publicity.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: As twisted as it may sound, putting up DarcyвЂ™s ransom is a ratings booster. Once we get her back, a lot of people are gonna want to hear her story. If theyвЂ™re smart, the execs at KBS will want her back alive as soon as possible. Casey looks to be in deep thought -- contemplating someth She finally breaks her silence --

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What if we canвЂ™t get the money in time? You canвЂ™t be sure KBS will just hand over this kind of cash with no questions asked. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m gonna have to agree with DeSantis on this one. If they know theyвЂ™re DarcyвЂ™s only hope, theyвЂ™11l cooperate. They have a lot more to gain by getting her back.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: It just seems like too big a risk.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: No. This wonвЂ™t work. ThereвЂ™s got to be an easier way of getting this money. Maybe from the police or the FBI. DonвЂ™t they prepare for situations like this?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: He said if we involve the police or FBI, heвЂ™s gone and DarcyвЂ™s as good as dead.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t know that.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You already know heвЂ™s been watching our every move. I guarantee you heвЂ™1l be watching this one.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: TimeвЂ™s already running out. How do you know for certain that these people at the network will cooperate?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: May I make a suggestion?
Cars are entering and exiting the front yellow gates of t busy television studio.  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis follows a busy Ms. Newman through the office. Sh is carrying a lot of paperwork and seems disinterested in DeSantisвЂ™s story.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: Put yourself in my position, Detective. What would you do if you were me? Just days after you let Darcy out of her contract, her ex fiance shows up asking for $500,000 in ransom money. You wouldnвЂ™t think that the least suspicious?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t know. I guess it would depend on my personal relationship with Darcy. Look, I know this is a lot to take in, Ms. Newman, but we donвЂ™t have a lot of time here --

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: Right. I get it. Ms. Newman enters her office as DeSantis follows behind, shutting the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Newman walks around her desk and sorts some paperwork she continues with DeSantis.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: You have 48 hours to get the money or sheвЂ™s dead, right?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Actually, itвЂ™s 36.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: Right. I saw that movie too. I think I produced it.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: It sounds suspicious, I know. But believe me, this couldnвЂ™t be more -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: Why havenвЂ™t I heard anything about this until now? Why havenвЂ™t you alerted the police or the FBI about DarcyвЂ™s disappearance.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: If youвЂ™d just listen one second --

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: I wonder what your Captain would feel about all this. IвЂ™m sure youвЂ™ve alerted him of DarcyвЂ™s abduction. Maybe I should give him a call and we can straighten this out right now. Ms. Newman picks up her phone. DeSantis quickly grabs it slams it down on the receiver. MS. NEWMAN (CONTвЂ™D) What the hell do you think youвЂ™re doing? DeSantis dials, puts the phone to his ear, listens.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Hey. ItвЂ™s Charlie. (listens) SheвЂ™s right here in front of me, Mr. Gold. Ms. Newman is taken back by this sudden change in events. She is stunned and visibly frightened. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) (into the phone) You wanna talk to her? DeSantis hands the phone to a very reluctant Ms. Newman.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: Hello? (listens) Yes, Mr. Gold. IвЂ™ve been made aware of the situation and IвЂ™m very sorry. (listens) Yes. IвЂ™m well aware of your time restraints. Detective DeSantis has been filling me in. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MS. NEWMAN (cont'd) (listens) No. Of course not. (listens) Yes, sir. I can guarantee you that KBS will be doing everything we can to ensure DarcyвЂ™s safe return. (listens) Yes, of course I will. (listens) Yes. Thank you. And may God be with you and your family. (listens) Yes. Goodbye. Ms. Newman hangs up the phone and stares back at DeSantis with a look of uncertainty in her eyes. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large U-HAUL VAN sits parked on the dirt path. The rear cab is open. Sitting a good thirty feet from the truck is MAN on a DIRT BIKE -- THE COWBOY. He is wearing his trademark black cowboy hat and face mask. He REVS THE MOTOR on his bike, giving it some juice. He t rides the bike up a long metal ramp, into the back of the van. The cowboy parks the bike and jumps out, closing the meta ramp and sliding door behind him. He continues to the driverвЂ™s side and gets in. The SOUND OF THE ENGINE STAR

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: The large U-HAUL continues up the long, dark path. The echoing ROAR OF THE ENGINE fills the night sky -- the tru slowly disappearing into the darkness. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DARCYвЂ™S S.U.V. slowly cruises down the quiet street. It the middle of the night. Not a soul in sight. The S.U.v. approaches an alley and stops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Parked halfway down the alley is the cowboyвЂ™s grey dodg up. The motor bike that was once strapped into the truck now gone. INT. S.U.V. Henry Gold sits behind the wheel with a cell phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Okay. IвЂ™m here.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I see you. INT. SHERIFF PATTERSONвЂ™S CAR Deputy Bracken drives through the dark avenues of this qu downtown with Sheriff Patterson at his side -- using an earpiece to listen in on Mr. Gold and the kidnapperвЂ™s conversation.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now, real slow-like, youвЂ™re gonna back down the alley in reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis also cruises down a dark alley with his head lig off. He slowly comes to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis also has a plug in his ear -- listening to the kidnapperвЂ™s demands.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re gonna keep going until you reach the fire escape. Then you stop. INT. SHERIFF PATTERSONвЂ™S CAR Deputy Bracken continues down the dark street with Sherif Patterson at his side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Stop the car. EXT. SHERIFF PATTERSONвЂ™S CAR They come to a halt. Out steps The Sheriff. EXT./INT. SHERIFF PATTERSONвЂ™S CAR Sheriff Patterson pops his head inside the window.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: When I give the word, you move it in. But not one second before. You got it?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Okay. See you there. Sheriff Patterson continues down the street on foot as hi Deputy pulls away. He puts a two way walkie to his mouth. SHERIFF PATTERSON (CONTвЂ™D) DeSantis? Are you in position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis responds with his two way walkie.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Copy that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Patterson pulls his gun from a holster as he continues down the street on foot.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: (into the walkie) All right. Just stay put and be ready to block that exit.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The S.U.V. pulls ahead of the alley a few feet, then begi down the alley in reverse. It slowly approaches the grey dodge pick-up and stops about twenty or thirty feet from bumper. INT. S.U.V. Mr. Gold puts the cell to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m here.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now youвЂ™re gonna take the money out. Then open up those back doors. Let me take a real good look. If I even think I see a shadow of something or someone...IвЂ™1]1 slit her throat. Tell me if you understand.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Great. Now get out. Mr. Gold opens his door and steps out with the BLACK MONE BAG in hand. It is filled with $500,000 cash. INT./EXT. S.U.V. Mr. Gold walks to the rear -- about to open the back door

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wait. Mr. Gold stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Open your coat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mr. Gold pulls open his coat, letting the cowboy take a p

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Take it off. Mr. Gold removes his coat and drops it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Put your hands up and turn around. Mr. Gold places his hands in the air and slowly turns, fa the back of the S.U.V.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now open up the doors. Mr. Gold opens the rear doors of the S.U.V. There is no o inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis listens carefully.

dialogues.speaker: THE COWBOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Real good, pops. WeвЂ™re halfway there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Patterson continues jogging down the street with gun drawn and in the other hand holding in his ear piece, still listening to every word. He slowly approaches the entrance to an alley. He peeks his head around the corner and notices the grey dodge pick-up sitting in an adjacent alley. He also notic the shadowy figure of a MAN hiding behind a trash dumpste

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: I see him. I see the son of a bitch. HeвЂ™s hiding behind the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis responds.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Is Darcy with him?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t tell.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t move in. Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™1l kill him.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™1ll kill her if he sees you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gold approaches the driverвЂ™s window of the grey pic with the bag of money, then suddenly -- THE COWBOY comes careening around the left-hand corner on a motor bike, wearing his trademark hat and mask, armed with a large MA LIGHT FLASHLIGHT. He shines the LIGHT into Mr. GoldвЂ™s f blinding him, knocking him over the head with the flashli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Patterson chases after the suspect.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Move it in! HeвЂ™s on the move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gold lay unconscious on the ground. The Cowboy grabs money bag, begins down the opposite end on his bike. Sheriff Patterson spots the motor bike speeding down the second alley, raises his weapon to fire. Before he can ge clear shot, the motor bike disappears behind a wall.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: DeSantis, heвЂ™s headed your way!  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis comes to a screeching halt in front of the alley exit, blocking the Cowboy in. The Cowboy also spots DeSantis and slams on his brakes. H pulls a very large .50 CALIBER REVOLVER with LASER SIGHTI from his side. DeSantis steps out of his car and runs into the alley wit his gun drawn. He stops and points his weapon at the suspect.

dialogues.speaker: DROP IT
dialogues.text: Sheriff Patterson comes careening around the corner and stops. He notices the stand-off between the two men.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Shoot him! WhatвЂ™re you waiting for?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Bracken cuts a hard right into the second alley, quickly making his way up the alley, toward The Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cowboy points his red laser light at DeSantisвЂ™ ches ready to pull the trigger. He has the detectiveвЂ™s life his hands. Sheriff Patterson points his pistol at The Cowboy, ready shoot the masked killer. He spots DeSantis in his line of fire and cannot take the shot. The Cowboy begins after DeSantis at full speed.

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE
dialogues.text: The Cowboy moves closer and closer to DeSantis -- who sta frozen and cannot take the shot.

dialogues.speaker: SHOOT HIM
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Cowboy drops his weapon and strikes DeSantis over the head with the large flashlight, knocking him to the groun The Cowboy passes DeSantisвЂ™ car and back onto the main street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dirt bike is out of sight almost immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis lays on the ground, grabbing his throbbing head pain. Sheriff Patterson runs down the alley toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cowboy is nowhere in sight. He has gotten away. EXT. SHERIFF PATTERSONвЂ™S OFFICE DeSantis peers through the glass at Sheriff Patterson pac back and forth on the phone. He is arguing with someone. Abruptly, The Sheriff slams the phone down on the receive Enter DeSantis. EXT./INT. SHERIFF PATTERSONвЂ™S OFFICE Sheriff Patterson gives DeSantis a look of complete conte

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: I thought I told you to wait at the motel. If The Golds see you here, theyвЂ™1l take your head off. If I donвЂ™t do it first.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You hear anything?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Oh, weвЂ™re just getting flooded with phone calls here, DeSantis! If you bothered putting a hole in that cowboy I guess we could be checking the local hospitals for gunshot wounds! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DeSantis hangs his head low -- in shame. Yet, he remains focused and continues droning on about the case.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m guessing he ditched the bike and had a back up car waiting somewhere close by.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Is that right? You know, youвЂ™re always one step ahead of us good oleвЂ™ boys, arenвЂ™t you? Or maybe youвЂ™re just covering for the fact that you just plain fucked up out there.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I couldnвЂ™t get a clear shot.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Hell, L.A.P.D.! You spend four days a week at the pistol range, you canвЂ™t shoot one lousy son of a bitch ten feet in front of you?! Deputy Bracken enters -- interrupting the men.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Not now, Billy! CanвЂ™t you see IвЂ™m busy in here!

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Sorry. The Golds wanna know whatвЂ™s happening?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: (to Bracken) DeSantis here was about to tell us what in the hell happened out there. (to DeSantis) Well? WeвЂ™re waiting!

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I couldnвЂ™t see well enough to get a clear shot. But he had me in his sights. All he had to do was pull the trigger and I was done. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DESANTIS (cont'd) But he didnвЂ™t. It took a lot of nerve for him to charge me the way he did. ItвЂ™s like he knew I wouldnвЂ™t take the shot.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s real interesting, DeSantis. Why the hell would he think that?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Because he knows IвЂ™ve figured out who he is. Deputy Bracken lets out a slight smirk, shaking his head contempt.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™ve figured it all out. Well tell me, DeSantis -- Who is he? If you donвЂ™t mind letting the rest of us simple minds in on your little secret.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Somebody close to Darcy. A friend. A boyfriend, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: DarcyвЂ™s boyfriend? TheyвЂ™re all in cahoots together now? Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s the only explanation I can come up with. Sheriff Patterson lowers his head and shakes it in frustration. He picks up a PHOTOGRAPH from his desk, hand it to DeSantis -- who inspects it.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO OF JANET COONEY
dialogues.text: Her dead body is bruised and badly beaten.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: That look familiar to you? Billy found that in the pick-up, under the driverвЂ™s seat. Now unless DarcyвЂ™s boyfriend drove into town to beat Cooney to death, IвЂ™d say this new little theory of yours is one big fuckinвЂ™ steaming pile of horse shit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DeSantis shuts his eyes in embarrassment. He hands the ph to Deputy Bracken who is smiling from ear to ear. SHERIFF PATTERSON (CONTвЂ™D) (to Deputy Bracken) Billy. I want you to escort the detective back to his motel. Let him pack his things. When heвЂ™s done, make sure heвЂ™s on the road and headed the right direction.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, boss. Sheriff Patterson excuses himself from the office, leavin DeSantis standing pitiful and shamed. He simply stares at the floor with nothing to say for himself. For the first time, he is completely speechless. INT. SHERIFFвЂ™S DEPARTMENT - MAIN WAITING ROOM The Golds, Casey and Leanne all listen as The Sheriff explains the latest news on DarcyвЂ™s abductor.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve arranged to set up road blocks on both ends of the interstate, within a hundred mile radius of here. Along with my staff, weвЂ™ve got men in five different counties looking for Darcy. Checking every local motel, every back road, bus depot and train station from here to Salt Lake. IвЂ™ve also contacted the state police. TheyвЂ™re putting an APB out on Darcy and our suspect. The FBI too. A field agent from the bureau will be here in the morning. I'вЂ™11 be officially turning over... (catching himself) DarcyвЂ™s investigation...to them.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: You assured us the safest thing for Darcy was to keep this quiet.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: I know. We did what was right and safe for Darcy at that time. But things are a bit different now. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

SHERIFF PATTERSON (cont'd) We made good with the ransom. This manвЂ™s got the money and the means to disappear for good. He can only expect us to come at him with everything we got. And thatвЂ™s exactly what weвЂ™re going to do.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a little late for heroics, Sheriff. Weither one of you could admit this was a situation you couldnвЂ™t handle. None of you. You just wanted to keep things nice and quiet so you didnвЂ™t put a scare in your precious little town. No! That would make too big of a mess! Sheriff Patterson hangs his head low as Mr. Gold continue let him have it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wanna help us now, Sheriff? You tell the FBI everything. You tell them how you insisted on keeping them from my daughterвЂ™s investigation to cover your ass. Then maybe you can tell them how you let a Los Angeles detective a hundred miles out of his jurisdiction let our daughterвЂ™s kidnapper get away right under your nose. Why donвЂ™t you put all that in your fucking report! Casey looks away and to the front door where Deputy Brack is escorting DeSantis out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casey pulls into the motel lot and parks in front of thei room. Deputy Bracken sits waiting in his squad car, taking noti of Casey. She ignores him and heads for the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis finishes packing his stuff into Casey, who quickly shuts the door behind a suitcase. Enter her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Why didnвЂ™t you take that shot?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s the Feds case now.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You think sheвЂ™s alive, donвЂ™t you?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: She wasnвЂ™t at the drop.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: That doesnвЂ™t mean sheвЂ™s dead. Even if you thought she was dead, why didnвЂ™t you take that shot? You had nothing to lose. He dropped his gun. DeSantis wants to answer Casey. The words are there, but just canвЂ™t. He stares at her for what seems like an eternity. Then...suddenly...he breaks his silence.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I canвЂ™t help her anymore. IвЂ™ve put in my time. SheвЂ™s sick, Casey. Very sick and thereвЂ™s nothing more me or you can do about that. Casey stands in shock by this statement. She wanted to he this, but didnвЂ™t expect to. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) But I think weвЂ™ve all known that for awhile now.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: She wanted a new life. You said so yourself. Now she has the chance. Away from everything and everybody. Casey covers her mouth as if sheвЂ™s going to be sick. Sh turns away from him and stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: What did this man talk her into? What the hell was she thinking? I donвЂ™t understand! Any of this! (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASEY (cont'd) No, Charlie! Why would she do this?!

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Maybe she feels like itвЂ™s her only way out. I donвЂ™t know. ItвЂ™s not your problem anymore.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You knew what she did here. YouвЂ™ve known this whole time. ThatвЂ™s why you kept it quiet. DeSantis doesnвЂ™t respond. He only smiles and changes th subject.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You know what I think, Casey?

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I think the best thing for all of us now is to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: You didnвЂ™t help her, Charlie. You only made things worse by not calling the police. You have to tell The Sheriff about this.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I tried that once. HeвЂ™s not listening.

dialogues.speaker: CASEY
dialogues.text: She could hurt herself. If sheвЂ™s out there and sick and needs help, I wanna help her.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Good luck with that. DeSantis passes Casey and exits the room, leaving Casey i complete shock. EXT.

dialogues.speaker: DESERT HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: DeSantis heads down the dark country highway, headed for home. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The camera TILTS DOWN as he reaches into the passenger se and grabs a pack of smokes. Resting underneath the cigarettes is an orange and white envelope marked U-HAUL. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis pulls into his driveway. He steps out and immediately walks to the trunk. He pops it open and there sits his suitcase, as well as a large SILVER BRIEFCASE. He grabs the suitcase and pulls it out, sets it down on t pavement. He then pulls out the silver briefcase and uses his free hand to shut the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis enters his dark home, shutting the door behind h The house is fairly empty. The cluttered mess that was on there is now a memory. There are cardboard boxes everywhe filled with personal belongings. It appears he is moving very soon. He drops his suitcase on the floor and continu into the kitchen with the SILVER BRIEFCASE.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: DeSantis hides the briefcase under the sink. He grabs a glass from a cabinet, sets it down. He reaches into the freezer and grabs a few ice cubes, tosses them into the glass. He grabs a bottle of whiskey, resting nearby on th counter and pours himself a good double shot. He takes a generous swig of the scotch. He continues across the home and to the FRONT WINDOW. He stares aimlessly into the distance at nothing, gulping do the rest of his drink. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We CLOSE ON the skeletal, decomposed remains of DARCY GOL the red desert sand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: THREE WEEKS LATER
dialogues.text: Standing hovered over the body is Sheriff Patterson and Deputy Bracken.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Where was she buried?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY BRACKEN
dialogues.text: We found a shallow hole and white shower curtain about a hundred yards from here. It was chewed up pretty good. Looks like the damn coyotes got to her.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: What about The Golds?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY BRACKEN
dialogues.text: HavenвЂ™t called them yet. I was waiting on you.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Call the coroner. I wanna get her out of here before I start making the calls.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY BRACKEN
dialogues.text: You got it. Deputy Bracken begins off as Sheriff Patterson stares at wretched, decomposed body with disgust. We PULL AWAY and GO WIDER AND WIDER to reveal Sheriff Patterson standing a good hundred yards from a SHALLOW GR As we stare into the grave, we notice a large AREA RUG inside. The remains of a WHITE SHOWER CURTAIN lay some te to fifteen feet from the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Patterson stands hovered over DarcyвЂ™s remains w lay on an examination table. Also standing over the body a young FORENSIC EXAMINER who is discussing the condition the body with The Sheriff. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: There is one visible entry wound on the victimвЂ™s chest. It was caused by a small, thin blade, approximately 3 inches in length and 1 inch in diameter. Probably a pocket knife of some sort. DeSantis enters the room -- grabbing the attention of a n so thrilled Sheriff Patterson. He tosses DeSantis a dirty stare as the young detective approaches the examination table. FORENSIC EXAMINER (CONTвЂ™D) The victim also suffered a fractured skull and jaw. Although she was stabbed, she died of extreme hemorrhaging in the brain as a result of trauma to the head. DeSantis focuses on the body closely. FORENSIC EXAMINER (CONTвЂ™D) Upon first examination, we find Maggot mass aggregation in the pelvic and genital regions of the body and also in the skull and nasal cavities. It was the particularly small size of the larvae that I found interesting. The fact that these maggots remained stabilized and didnвЂ™t continue their growth cycle suggests the body remained in a cooler climate. I also found empty puparium on the underside of the body and on the remains of the shower curtain.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: It means that the victim had remained under ground for a duration of no less than twenty days. Which places time of death, at the latest, one to two days, maybe even hours after her abduction. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Is there anything else about the body we should know about?

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: ThereвЂ™s no signs of sexual assault. DeSantis shuts his eyes -- sighing in relief.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: There is one thing. DeSantis quickly opens his eyes and turns his attention b to the examiner. FORENSIC EXAMINER (CONTвЂ™D) The size of the maggots in the victimвЂ™s nasal cavity is of a particularly large size. Almost three times the normal size, to be precise. This strongly suggests years of repeated cocaine abuse.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: She was a coke addict?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t see the importance of that now.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: As you know, Detective, IвЂ™m legally obligated to record any forms of substance abuse in my report. ItвЂ™s for identification purposes.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I can appreciate that. But as far as this girlвЂ™s parents are concerned, she never had a coke problem and has been drug free and sober for eight months. When the press gets a hold of this, sheвЂ™1l be all over the front page.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: What is it exactly youвЂ™re asking me to do, detective? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FORENSIC EXAMINER (cont'd) To falsify my findings in order to ease the grieving process of this girlвЂ™s parents.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Sheriff? Would you excuse us a moment. Sheriff Patterson reluctantly steps out of the office. DeSantis gives the examiner the evil eye. The examiner simply returns his stare. The two men stand silent, stari each other down. We then very slowly... FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golds, Casey and Leanne await in a hallway outside th examination room. The Golds sit on a bench, grasping each others hands tight as Casey and Leanne pace back and fort the cold hard floor. Sheriff Patterson and DeSantis exit the exam room, catchi everyoneвЂ™s attention. Mr. Gold quickly stands and approaches The Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m very sorry. Mr. Gold loses control -- SCREAMING out in despair and crumbling to his knees. Sheriff Patterson grabs him, but pulled down by his weight. The two men both fall to their knees. He slowly puts his arms around Mr. Gold, comfortin him. Mrs. Gold pulls her husband away from The Sheriff and hol him tight. Casey and Leanne also weep for their friend. They walk ov to The Golds and place their arms around them. They all h and mourn together. Sheriff Patterson shuts his eyes, unable to witness the unbearable scene before him. DeSantis is taken over by guilt. He turns and walks off. Sheriff Patterson turns and notices that DeSantis has suspiciously left.  sl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VERY WIDE SHOT of the worn, old station. From a distance, see DeSantisвЂ™ car pull into the station and park in fro a pay phone booth. Out steps DeSantis who walks into the booth and picks up the phone. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MEN enter the division of Internal Affairs. The first Man through the door is LT. WOLF (40s). Following behind DETECTIVE AARONSON (30s) a very youthful appearance. Sitt at his desk, behind a computer is DETECTIVE HARRIS (40s).

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF
dialogues.text: Harris? Wake up. Det. Harris spins around in his chair, facing Lt. Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF
dialogues.text: I want you to meet Detective Kyle Aaronson. The two men shake.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON
dialogues.text: Hey there.

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s his first official day with I.A.D. IвЂ™m putting him with you on the DeSantis case.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Have you already been briefed?

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON
dialogues.text: No, not yet.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS
dialogues.text: Take a seat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Det. Aaronson has a seat across from Harris, while Lt. Wo stands hovered over the men. Det. Harris hands Aaronson a stack of thick files on DeSantis. DET. HARRIS (CONTвЂ™D) Detective Charlie DeSantis, narcotics division. A degenerate gambler, wife beater and all around bad guy. We just got word from one of our C.I.вЂ™s that heвЂ™s into Artie Vittero for $75 grand. Coming out of vice, IвЂ™m sure youвЂ™re aware of Mr. VitteroвЂ™s activities.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON
dialogues.text: (nodding in agreement) Oh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS
dialogues.text: This C.I. says that DeSantis has less than three weeks to square his debt or heвЂ™s a dead man. Now it just so happens that DeSantis requests a stress leave and mysteriously leaves Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s on the run?

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF
dialogues.text: Exactly. The word from his Captain is DeSantis needed some personal time to deal with his partnerвЂ™s recent death. HeвЂ™s been cracking up ever since he saw him killed.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS
dialogues.text: According to this C.I., DeSantis has been bringing a lot of heat down on himself by putting thousands of dollars in counterfeit cash onto the streets.

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF
dialogues.text: Supposedly, there may even be a price on his head. He said the word is, heвЂ™s been making a lot of drug buys. Generating some names. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS
dialogues.text: We think heвЂ™s been trying to get closer to a Ramon Vasquez, an east side cholo, piece a shit who shot his partner six months ago.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON
dialogues.text: They never caught this guy?

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF
dialogues.text: By the time they found Vasquez, DeSantis had already beaten him within an inch of his life. VasquezвЂ™s lawyer saw to it that all charges against his client were dropped. Ever since, DeSantis has been trying to put him away. HeвЂ™s obsessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis sits at the kitchen table with the SILVER BRIEFC opened. He stares into the case at the money.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: So where did all this money come from? He grabs a hand full of the cash and stuffs it into a man envelope.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We have reason to believe DeSantis stole over 2 million in counterfeit cash from a drug bust he says went sour. He wraps a rubber band around the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Narcotics sends him in with the funny money to make the deal. Fifty kis. He walks to his bedroom, grabs a long coat from his close (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: According to DeSantis, they put a gun to his head and made out with the coke and the cash.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He says somebody on the inside blew his cover. Somebody told them he was a cop, all right. It was DeSantis. DeSantis stuffs the envelope into his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And he keeps the phoney cash handy to support his gambling habit.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And pay off his debts. 84. DeSantis walks to the kitchen and shuts the SILVER BRIEFC full of cash.

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I just got off the phone with Captain Gruber in narcotics. He says he just got a call from Bryerson, Utah, SheriffвЂ™s office. The Sheriff there says DeSantis has been there for weeks, investigating the kidnapping of an old girlfriend. Darcy Gold. He says he thought we should know. DeSantis walks to the center of his living room and open an ATTIC DOOR. He unfolds a small ladder from and begins up the small steps.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s an actress here in LA. The word is DeSantis went to DarcyвЂ™s producer at KBS, an Alicia Newman, and requested the $500,000 in ransom money.

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTIC
dialogues.text: pulls the attic DeSantis places the silver briefcase in a dark corner, ou sight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He told her whoever snatched Darcy contacted him and said if he didnвЂ™t get the money within 48 hours, heвЂ™d kill her. He begins back down the ladder and into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And they actually gave him the money? DeSantis folds up the ladder and shuts the attic door.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis exits his home -- walks to his car and gets in. pulls out of the driveway as we watch him begin down the street.

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A couple days ago, the Bryerson SheriffвЂ™s office found a body in the desert. The coroner officially identified the body as one Darcy Gold.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, DarcyвЂ™s killer has mysteriously disappeared into thin air and no one has the first clue who he is or where to find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gold exits -- makes his way toward the mail box.

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Bottom line, we think DeSantis is working with someone.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who? (CONTINUED)
LT. WOLF (CONTвЂ™D)(V.O.) The same person who kidnapped and murdered Darcy Gold. Who that is, we donвЂ™t know yet.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What does this Utah Sheriff have to say about it?

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s obviously suspicious of DeSantis. But he doesnвЂ™t have all the facts. And thatвЂ™s how weвЂ™re gonna keep it. DeSantis is a smart cop. Mr. Gold approaches the mail box and opens it -- pulling the dayвЂ™s mail.

dialogues.speaker: LT. WOLF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™1l smell trouble a mile away. The smartest thing we can do now is wait.

dialogues.speaker: DET. AARONSON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Wait for what? Mr. Gold sifts through the mail and notices an envelope w the logo WESTLAKE INSURANCE at the top left corner.

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Wait for him to relax and think he got away with it. Mr. Gold opens the envelope and pulls out a check in the amount of A look of

dialogues.speaker: DET. HARRIS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Hopefully, heвЂ™1ll slip up and get careless. And thatвЂ™s when weвЂ™1ll nail him. pure shock consumes Mr. GoldвЂ™s face. FADE TO BLACK.  87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Gold is busy putting away leftover fried chicken and mashed potatoes into tupperware containers. She is cleani up the kitchen after a large family supper. She peaks through the kitchen window and spots her husband and Darc a porch swing outside. DarcyвЂ™s head is rested in her fatherвЂ™s lap as she fin bowl of ice cream. He lovingly strokes her hair back as t continue to swing back and forth. Mrs. Gold smiles at the loving scene. DarcyвЂ™s like a ki again.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT PORCH
dialogues.text: Mr. Gold and Darcy continue to swing back and forth as Da dishes out her problems to her father.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: When am I ever gonna catch a break, daddy? IвЂ™m on the show one stinkinвЂ™ season and theyвЂ™re already plotting to get rid of me.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Oh, come on now. They just got caught with their pants down. ItвЂ™s got nothing to do with whether people like you or not. Look at you. YouвЂ™re young, beautiful, smart, and you got me for a father. What more could a girl want? Darcy smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry I lied to you and Mom before. I didnвЂ™t know how you guys would take the news.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Just remember. YouвЂ™re better off than Jennifer Conway. She couldnвЂ™t cut it on her own show so she had to come crawling back. But not you. YouвЂ™re going all the way. Just watch. Movies, the Oscars, the whole bit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Thanks, dad. Darcy smiles at her father. She notices that his nose is bleeding. DARCY (CONTвЂ™D) Dad? Your nose is bleeding. Darcy quickly sits up. Henry uses his finger to wipe the blood from his nose.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Damn it. Darcy pulls a tissue from her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Here. She begins wiping her fatherвЂ™s nose. He snatches the ti from her hand as he begins coughing like crazy. DARCY (CONTвЂ™D) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m fine. He continues to cough.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: IвЂ™1l get you some water. Darcy jumps from the swing and continues into

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: where Mrs. Gold is scrubbing out some pots in the sink. Darcy pulls a drinking glass from a nearby cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: You look so cute out there with your father. ItвЂ™s just like when you were a kid.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Yeah. The simple days. I wouldnвЂ™t mind having those back.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mrs. Gold stares at her husband through the kitchen windo with a look of concern on her face. MRS. GOLD (CONTвЂ™D) Oh well. We canвЂ™t turn back time, now can we? Darcey notices her motherвЂ™s obvious gloom.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Mom? Has Daddy been doing okay? He doesnвЂ™t look so hot.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: HeвЂ™s been sick on and off for a few weeks now.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Has he been to a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: You know your father. HeвЂ™d be bleeding from the eyes before he stepped into a hospital. Darcy stares at her mother with suspicion. She continues of the kitchen. Mrs. Gold turns and notices that Darcy ha left the room. She sighs in relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy walks in and over to the sink -- begins filling the drinking glass with the cold water. She canвЂ™t help but notice a stack of magazines sitting left of the faucet. On top sits a special medical magazin entitled WHAT EVERY PATIENT NEEDS TO KNOW. She picks up the magazine and begins flipping through it. She spots a page marked SECTION 1: PREPARING FOR YOUR TRANSPLANT. She flips through a few more pages and spots page marked SECTION 2: THE TRANSPLANT PROCESS. Darcy sets the magazine back where she found it. She look up and stares at herself in a side mirror. She opens the side cabinet and spots A PRESCRIPTION BOTTLE. She pulls t bottle from the cabinet and reads the label. It is marked PROPRANOLOL. She also notices a large liquid glass container. A medical label reads LACTULOSE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She puts the medication back in the cabinet as a look of fear covers her face. INT. DARCYвЂ™S APARTMENT - DAY Darcy sits at home at her computer, doing research. She i on the website DOGPILE.COM. She types in the words PROPRANOLOL and LACTULOSE into the search box and hits fe HER P.O.V. A medical webpage pops up.

dialogues.speaker: PARAGRAPH
dialogues.text: вЂњSome patients who have had bleeding from ruptured vari veins in the lower oesophagus may be put onto a drug call Propranolol which reduces the pressure in those veins and lowers the chances of them bleeding again. Finally, liver transplantation may be considered in patients with end-st cirrhosis.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Darcy reads the shocking information concerning her fathe medication.

dialogues.speaker: PARAGRAPH
dialogues.text: вЂњLactulose is used in higher doses to help reduce a complication associated with liver disease called hepatic encephalopathy.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Darcy shuts her eyes and rests her hands on her weary fac She goes to the FILE MENU on her computer and selects the PRINT OPTION. A copy of the webpage begins to print.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FULL SHOT of the home. From a distance, we see DarcyвЂ™ S.U.V approaching the home and pulling into the long driveway. Out steps Darcy. She is carrying with her a manila folder filled with paperwork. We watch Darcy from a distance as she approaches the fron door and rings the doorbell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MR. GOLD answers. We see that the two exchange some words but cannot hear what is going on. We are watching only as voyeurs. Darcy opens the manila folder, pulls out the paperwork and hands it to her father. A few seconds pass Mr. Gold invites her inside. We SLOWLY DISSOLVE into night time. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Exits the front door in tears. She is crying heavily. She continues to her car and gets in. INT. S.U.V. Darcy continues to cry. She quickly begins out of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The S.U.V. darts down the street at very high speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON the front window. We peek through the glass at T Golds -- both in tears as they watch Darcy storm down the street. INT. DARCYвЂ™S APARTMENT BUILDING - PARKING GARAGE - NIGH Darcy pulls her S.U.V. into an empty spot. INT. S.U.V. Darcy shuts off her engine, continues to cry heavily. INT. MICHAELвЂ™S APARTMENT - NIGHT Michael is in bed, sleeping. He suddenly hears a KNOCKING the door. He quickly crawls out of bed and puts ona bathrobe. He continues to the front door and answers. He in shock to see DARCY standing before him.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: A little late for dinner, arenвЂ™t you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Darcy stares up at Michael with a sad, desperate look in eye. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: INT. MICHAELвЂ™S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - MORNING Michael is still sleeping. He rolls over and attempts to cuddle with Darcy, but no one is there. She has left. He quickly opens his eyes and notices that Darcy is gone. He sits up in bed and turns his attention to the BATHROOM. Notices that the door is shut.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Darcy? There is no answer from the bathroom. MICHAEL (CONTвЂ™D) Hello? Michael realizes sheвЂ™s gone. He grabs his portable phon from a night stand and dials. He rests the phone to his e INT. DARCYвЂ™S APARTMENT вЂ”- MORNING Darcy is dressed for her morning jog. Her look is somewhe between angry and regretful. Her phone begins RINGING -- stopping her on the way out the door. She looks down at the phone, knowing itвЂ™s Michael and pondering whether or not to answer. She decides against a continues out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy jogging down the sidewalk. Her regular morning routine. As she jogs, we see DarcyвЂ™s thoughts unfold be our eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a ratings war, Darcy. And weвЂ™re losing. In the end, it all comes down to the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ms. Newman breaking the bad news to Darcy.

dialogues.speaker: MS. NEWMAN
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry, Darcy. You donвЂ™t know how much it hurts me to do this. Darcy having dinner with her parents.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re a winner, Darcy. ItвЂ™s in your blood. Get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT DAY
dialogues.text: Darcy jogging down the sidewalk, obviously affected by he thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Honey? Is there something youвЂ™re not telling us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. GoldвЂ™s nose begins to bleed. Darcy takes notice.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Your nose is bleeding. Darcy and Mrs. Gold in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Has he been to a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: You know your father. HeвЂ™d be bleeding from the eyes before he stepped into a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT DAY
dialogues.text: Darcey jogging even faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darcy confronts her father at the front door.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: I know youвЂ™re sick. I know what medications youвЂ™re taking and I know youвЂ™re looking into a transplant. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DARCY (cont'd) I need you and Mom to quit lying to me and tell me what the hellвЂ™s going on. Mr. Gold is overcome with grief.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT DAY
dialogues.text: Darcy jogs faster and faster.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Why donвЂ™t you come inside. We can talk about it. DarcyвЂ™s jogging begins to slow as she starts crying. Sh eventually stops altogether -- burying her face in her ha She is completely overcome with grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gold is busy throwing a tennis ball back and forth wi his golden retriever. DARCY steps off the back porch, toward her father. She lo tired and miserable. The sound of the back door shutting catches Mr. GoldвЂ™s attention.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Hi, baby. I didnвЂ™t know you were here.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Just got here.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: HowвЂ™d things go with Ms. Newman? Darcy looks down and nervously begins playing with her fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Not so good.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Oh? You couldnвЂ™t get them to change their mind? Darcy shakes her head -- too upset to say the words. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s over.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m so sorry, Darcy.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t be. The last thing you should be worrying about now is me. IвЂ™ve been enough trouble for you and Mom already. Mr. Gold retrieves the tennis ball from his dog and stare Darcey with concern. DARCY (CONTвЂ™D) The truth is if it werenвЂ™t for you, I probably wouldnвЂ™t be alive right now. I know I wouldnвЂ™t. I know sometimes it seems like I donвЂ™t appreciate you guys. But I do. I really do. Mr. Gold is seemingly touched by his daughterвЂ™s sinceri DARCY (CONTвЂ™D) Sometimes I get real angry because...it seems like you wonвЂ™t let me grow up. But IвЂ™m really just angry at myself because I know deep down I could never make it without you. Darcy can no longer hold back the tears. She loses it. DARCY (CONTвЂ™D) And IвЂ™m angry because I never said thank you. Thank you for being there and for being my daddy. It hurts so bad because I wanna help you like you helped me, but I canвЂ™t. Mr. Gold hurries over to his daughter and gives her a gia hug.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Just you being here right now is enough. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: (crying) Why didnвЂ™t you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: I guess I was afraid. Your mother and I thought you needed some time to get back on your feet. We just wanted to wait and see what our options were before we said anything.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m sorry. IвЂ™m so sorry, dad.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s okay. YouвЂ™re here now. From a distance, we watch as the two continue to embrace. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Patterson, DeSantis and the forensic examiner hov over the supposed remains of Darcy Gold.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Sheriff? Would you excuse us a moment? Sheriff Patterson reluctantly steps out -- leaving the detective and the coroner to each other.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: Sorry, DeSantis. But my price just went up.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Darcy never used coke.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: I know. ItвЂ™s called a bargaining chip. I get what I want and I wonвЂ™t send this report to DarcyвЂ™s physicians in Los Angeles. IвЂ™m sure theyвЂ™1ll find my report very fascinating. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (om) 97. FORENSIC EXAMINER (cont'd) After going through that rehab clinic, IвЂ™m sure they know DarcyвЂ™s drug history real good. ItвЂ™s only a matter of time before they figure out the truth.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You stupid son of a bitch. Do you even know what youвЂ™re doing?

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: Now come on, Detective. What did you expect? She was a hooker. TheyвЂ™re not exactly Snow White.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You knew Cooney was a user this whole time.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: Of course. Everyone did. But it was your idea to use her body. Not mine. You put me in a hell of a spot, Charlie. IвЂ™m just trying to protect my best interests.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: I got news for you. This is my show now. Unless you want Sheriff dipshit in on our little secret, you better do exactly as I tell you.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: I want another fifty grand. And I want it tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: No. RogerвЂ™s Park. Midnight. If youвЂ™re one second late, IвЂ™m faxing this report to LA. WhatвЂ™s it gonna be? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DeSantis grabs the examiner and shoves him backward. FORENSIC EXAMINER (CONTвЂ™D) DonвЂ™t be so angry, cop. YouвЂ™re acting like IвЂ™ve never done this before. DeSantis grabs him by the shirt and pushes him against a wall. FORENSIC EXAMINER (CONTвЂ™D) Careful. Your boyfriendвЂ™s outside. You shouldвЂ™ve known better. Did you really think I was gonna let you screw me again? I got all those bodies for you and your mob friends and what do you do? You try to fuck me out of my money. Now IвЂ™m on the run from that greaseball for the rest of my life.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Nobody told you to testify, you dumb shit.

dialogues.speaker: FORENSIC EXAMINER
dialogues.text: Strike two, DeSantis. Now I want a hundred. DeSantis tries like hell to restrain himself. FORENSIC EXAMINER (CONTвЂ™D) You wanna make it two hundred? DeSantis begins to calm himself. FORENSIC EXAMINER (CONTвЂ™D) Take your hands off me. DeSantis slowly lets go of the man and backs away. INT. CORONERвЂ™S OFFICE - CITY MORGUE The forensic examiner opens a file drawer. He flips throu the files until he reaches one labeled COONEY, JANET. He pulls the file from the drawer and lays it on a table.

dialogues.speaker: TABLE
dialogues.text: Next to the file is another manila envelope marked GOLD, DARCY. Also laying on the table is a piece of paperwork. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We see various shots of words like вЂњGold, DarcyвЂќ and mortemвЂќ He pulls the dental charts and paper work from the Cooney folder, which are carefully separated by PRE-MORTEM and P MORTEM records. He removes the X-rays from both sets of paperwork and places them on the table. He begins filling out the necessary paper work for Darcy GoldвЂ™s post-mort dental records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golds, Casey and Leanne await patiently in a waiting for Sheriff Patterson and DeSantis. The same as before: Casey and Leanne pacing on the floor, The Golds awaiting bench. Sheriff Patterson and DeSantis exit the coronerвЂ™s offic Mr. Gold stands and approaches Sheriff Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF PATTERSON
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m very sorry. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantisвЂ™ car pulls up next to another CAR in the middl nowhere. He steps out and approaches the other car. The driverвЂ™s side door opens and out steps MICHAEL (DarcyвЂ neighbor). He is carrying the BLACK MONEY BAG. He turns t bag upside down and dumps several heavy books onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s real good thinking, detective. Something tells me you donвЂ™t exactly trust me.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Stop where I can see you. DeSantis pulls his gun out and points it at Michael -- wh quickly drops the black bag and places his hands in the a (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Take it easy. If I wanted to kill you, I wouldвЂ™ve done it back in that alley.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Turn and face the car and put your hands on the hood. Michael laughs -- shakes his head in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t believe this. Michael reluctantly turns and places his palms on the hoo the car. DeSantis quickly pats him down for weapons. MICHAEL (CONTвЂ™D) I donвЂ™t have a gun anymore, remember?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Shut up. DeSantis walks to the trunk of his car and opens it. He pulls out another large BLACK BAG and begins back to Mich He places the bag on the roof of MichaelвЂ™s car and unzi He pulls out his share of the money and tosses it in fron Michael -- who is still palms down on the hood. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) ItвЂ™s all there. Michael reaches down and grabs a hand full of the cash. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) You know what you have to do to get the rest. Michael backs away from the hood with the money in hand.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™ve been doing some thinking about that.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? WhatвЂ™ve you been thinking about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I was thinking, if and when I were to do this, how do I know youвЂ™1ll keep your word and pay me my money?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You donвЂ™t.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Then what if I were to tell you to go to hell?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Then I let Darcy look at that long rap sheet of yours. And when she finds out what a piece of shit, drug dealing pervert you really are, she wonвЂ™t want anything more to do with you. MichaelвЂ™s demeanor suddenly changes, knowing that DeSan has his number.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t think for one second youвЂ™re smarter than me. Michael laughs and shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Darcy told me to watch out for you. She said you were tricky. I guess this means weвЂ™re partners again. DeSantis slowly walks over to Michael. He gets in his fac Michael is seemingly intimidated by this.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I want it done tonight. I donвЂ™t care how you do it. But she doesnвЂ™t leave this town alive.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, detective. DeSantis returns to his car and gets in. He drives off, kicking up the desert sand behind him. Michael watches as DeSantis continues down the desert roa He stands watching -- as the car becomes invisible. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He puts the money in his coat pocket and reluctantly begi into his car. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael exits an acting workshop after a long session. He continues down a sidewalk and approaches his car, parked against a curb. There is a message waiting under his windshield wiper. He picks it up, reads.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL,
dialogues.text: MEET ME AT EL DORADOвЂ™S ON SAN VICENTE, 2 OвЂ™CLOCK,

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Michael smiles, crumples up the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael patiently awaits outside of the club at a small l table. He is sipping on a cool drink while he waits for Darcy. A hand touches his shoulder. He turns and notices DESANTIS approaching him from behind He has a seat across from him.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Surprise, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Sorry about the note on your car. I figured it would get you here quicker. I was right. YouвЂ™re ten minutes early.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What do you want? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t hear from you yesterday. YouвЂ™re supposed to be giving me updates. That was the deal.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I was busy.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: And what exactly were you busy doing, Michael? Michael sits silent -- knowing where DeSantis is taking t DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) DonвЂ™t act so surprised, Michael. I had your apartment bugged just like DarcyвЂ™s. So you two are getting pretty close now.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: She came over. She was upset.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I know. I heard. Sounded like things got pretty hot between you two. Sucks to be the shoulder to ery on, but someoneвЂ™s got to do it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Look, I told you everything you need to know. She hasnвЂ™t talked to Internal Affairs and they arenвЂ™t talking to her. WNothingвЂ™s changed. I never lied to you.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You sound suspiciously like someone whoвЂ™s trying to hide something, Michael. DeSantis sits silent -- gazing intimidatingly back at Michael. After a full ten seconds of awkward silence -- Michael finally breaks.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Okay. She told me about some money she found at your place. It was right before she broke things off with you. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MICHAEL (cont'd) Then she tells me about how you just show up at her place at odd hours, asking her questions about who sheвЂ™s been talking to. The only thing thatвЂ™s keeping her from going to the cops is the fact sheвЂ™s scared shitless of you.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Okay, Michael. I want you to listen carefully. If I.A. shows up on my doorstep asking a bunch of questions about stolen money, IвЂ™m gonna assume either you or Darcy talked. IвЂ™m also gonna assume you lied to me. You know the rest. DeSantis lays down a manila envelope on the table and sta to leave. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) ThereвЂ™s another ten grand if you decide thereвЂ™s something else I should know about. I hope you do the right thing. A lot of innocent lives may depend on your decision. IвЂ™1l see you around. DeSantis walks off. Michael grabs the envelope and opens It is filled with loose bills, about $10,000. INT. MICHAELвЂ™S APARTMENT - NIGHT Michael enters -- carrying a large bag of groceries. He heads for the kitchen and lays the bag down on the counte top. The sound of DESANTIS in the b.g. startles him.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: You should get a better lock for that door. Michael quickly turns around, pulling out a .9MM HANDGUN his coat and points the weapon at a DARK FIGURE sitting i corner chair. DeSantis flicks on a nearby lamp, revealing himself to Michael.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t shoot. IвЂ™m allergic. Michael continues to point his weapon at DeSantis. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What the hellвЂ™re you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I came to talk to you about another job.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: IвЂ™m not interested in any more of your jobs, cop.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: (motioning to gun) Do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Have you talked to Darcy lately?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: HavenвЂ™t seen her, havenвЂ™t talked to her. Now for the last time, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: I figured out a way to help DarcyвЂ™s old man. But IвЂ™m gonna need your help. Yours and DarcyвЂ™s.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Why the hell would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Because youвЂ™re in love with her. If thereвЂ™s anything I can do, Darcy. IsnвЂ™t that what you told her right before she cried herself to sleep in your arms? A sore subject for Michael. He puts the hammer back on hi weapon and places it back in his coat. He continues into kitchen and begins emptying his groceries. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) I know you wanna help her, Michael. Well IвЂ™m giving you the chance. Might be your only chance of getting her back. You can either take it or you can continue to be a miserable sack of shit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Michael grabs a beer and continues back into the living r

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Okay, cop. WhatвЂ™s in it for you?

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: If we do this right, we all come out on top. Not just Darcy and her father. IвЂ™m talking serious money with minimal risk. All I need to know is if youвЂ™re in or out. Michael stands silent -- gulping down his beer and gawkin back at DeSantis -- who simply returns his stare, patient awaiting an answer. EXT. MICHAELвЂ™S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT DeSantis exits the building and continues down a sidewalk Watching carefully from his apartment window is MICHAEL. stares at the detective with extreme suspicion and apprehension. DeSantis stops and stares back at Michael, smiles at him. Michael notices and slowly backs away from the window. DeSantis pulls a cigarette from his pack and sparks it up still smiling in the direction of MichaelвЂ™s apartment w He continues up the sidewalk. CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His car pulls into the driveway. Out steps DeSantis -- wh walks to the rear of the car and opens his trunk. He reac inside and pulls out the large BLACK MONEY BAG. He shuts trunk and continues into his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis enters. He walks further into the home with the money bag -- dropping it in the center of the room. He continues into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DeSantis runs a shower. Before he gets undressed, he walk back into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: He grabs the black money bag from the ground and continue into the kitchen. He places the bag on the kitchen table unzips it. He then kicks his right leg up onto a chair, pulls his pant leg up and yanks out a small HANDGUN from ankle holster. He places the weapon into the money bag an zips it back up.

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: DeSantis is in the middle of a shower. He hears the faint sound of his CELL PHONE RINGING. He quickly turns off the water and grabs a towel from a nearby rack. He steps out of the shower and grabs his cell phone from the bathroom sink, answers.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Yeah? DeSantis? No answer. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s done.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: CarlвЂ™s grocery on highway 30. About fifteen miles east of Kanab. DeSantis stands in shock. He cannot bring himself to ask question.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Where is she? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: SheвЂ™s real close. I can show you if youвЂ™d like.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Stay put. I/вЂ™11 be there in three hours. Michael hangs up. DeSantis catches a glimpse of himself i the mirror, not liking what he sees. He turns away from t mirror and continues to dry off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis finishes getting dressed. He grabs his gun and holster from a night stand, places them on his belt and continues into the

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: where his black money bag sits rested on the dining table He grabs the money bag and walks to the front door. Exits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis exits and continues to his car. He gets in and pulls out of his driveway in a hurry. Sitting in a parked car down the street and watching closely is MICHAEL. He waits until the detectiveвЂ™s car is invisible, then g out. He struts across the street toward the home. As he approaches the front door, he pulls out a spare KEY that Darcy has given him. He unlocks the front door and walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks further into the home and quickly begins searching the premise for the stolen ransom money.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Michael checks the bedroom closet, tearing it apart. Michael searches the kitchen cabinets. Michael searches under the kitchen sink. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Michael becomes frustrated. He spots the attic door on th ceiling and quickly pulls it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael unfolds the ladder from the attic and begins up. reaches the top and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael notices the SILVER BRIEFCASE of money sitting in corner. He grabs it and begins back down the ladder. As h steps off, he notices DESANTIS sitting in a living room chair, holding a gun and resting his arms on the chair. Michael stops in his tracks -- completely taken by surpri

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: What did I tell you about thinking youвЂ™re smarter than me, Michael? You and I both knew there was only one thing that could come from you taking me to see DarcyвЂ™s body. Either you kill me or I kill you. Michael is frozen with fear. He canвЂ™t take his eyes off DeSantisвЂ™ gun. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) You played it cool in Utah when I gave you that fifty grand in funny money. But you played it off. You did the right thing and kept your mouth shut. You wanted to wait until my guard was down to come take my money. So let me see if I can get this straight... Michael turns his attention from the gun to DeSantis. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) ++-You never killed Darcy. And not only is she still alive...you and that cunt were gonna run off with my money together. DeSantis points his gun at Michael. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) Where is she? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: If I tell you, youвЂ™1l kill me.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Believe me...itвЂ™ll hurt a lot worse if you donвЂ™t. DeSantis cocks the weapon and points it at MichaelвЂ™s genitals.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I can take you to her. I can still do it. I can kill her if you want. DeSantis slowly lowers his gun.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Good. Very good, Michael. You just bought yourself a second chance. Michael lets out a huge sigh of relief -- giggles nervous

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: You almost made me piss myself. Tell you what. Let me take a quick leak and weвЂ™ll go do this. DeSantis stares at Michael with apprehension.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You got thirty seconds. Michael reluctantly turns his back on DeSantis and heads the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael reaches into the back of his pants and pulls out small AUTOMATIC PISTOL. He pulls back the slide, cocking weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis pulls out a large CUTTING KNIFE from a rack on t kitchen counter. He slowly moves toward the bathroom.  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael holds a cell phone to his ear and gun in his hand Suddenly, DeSantis kicks in the door and pushes Michael backward. He has Michael in one hand and the large KNIFE the other. He pushes the young thug into the shower door almost shattering it and knocking the phone out of Michae hand. DeSantis drives the knife into MichaelвЂ™s gut -- retract then once more as Michael drops to the floor. He spits up blood onto the cold, hard tile and grabs his gut in pain. DeSantis yanks a hand towel from a nearby rack and tosses to Michael.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Put some pressure on the wound. YouвЂ™re gonna bleed out. Michael grabs the towel and holds it to his stomach. DeSantis notices the cell phone on the floor. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) What is this? He reaches down and picks it up -- puts it to his ear. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) Michael canвЂ™t come to the phone right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMANвЂ™S HAND hangs up a phone on its receiver. Who is mystery woman? Darcy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis hangs up the cell phone. He hovers over Michael with the knife in his hand. A crazed look in his eyes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: You must think this all comes easy for me. Taking lives. Watching someone die. Did you know I held my partnerвЂ™s wife in my arms for four hours when I broke the news to her. She blamed me for what happened, you know? IвЂ™m just trying to make things right again. Nobody understands that. Darcy never understood. She was too selfish. But she always was a spoiled little bitch. DeSantis kicks Michael in his wounded stomach. He SCREAMS out in agony. The detective reaches down and runs his hand through MichaelвЂ™s pockets. He pulls out a MOTEL ROOM KEY. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) (staring at the key) WhatвЂ™s this, Michael? Room 101. Is this where you two love birds are hiding? Michael once again SCREAMS out in agony. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) I told you IвЂ™d make it hurt if you tried to fuck me, didnвЂ™t I? Now look at you. IsnвЂ™t this a sight? A real life, living piece of shit dies next to my toilet. The irony.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Oh, such foul language from such an upstanding citizen. Tell you what IвЂ™m gonna do. IвЂ™m gonna go get your girlfriend. But IвЂ™1l be back. You can run, but the nearest hospitalвЂ™s fifteen minutes. You move, youвЂ™ll probably bleed out in five. Your best bet is to sight tight until I get back. DeSantis pulls MichaelвЂ™s gun from the floor and pulls b the slide -- cocking the weapon. He ejects the clip and rests the gun on the bathroom sink. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) There. ThereвЂ™s one in the chamber. In case the painвЂ™s a little too much for you. Consider it giving you an easy way out. A look of pure hatred consumes MichaelвЂ™s face. DESANTIS (CONTвЂ™D) If I donвЂ™t see you when I get back..-itвЂ™s been real. Take care. DeSantis smiles and continues out of the bathroom, shutti the door behind him. Michael attempts to sit up, but the pain is too intense. stares up at the handgun rested on the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis pulls into the small lot, in front of room 101. gets out and begins toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis enters with his gun drawn. There is no one in sight. He notices that the bed isnвЂ™t made, as if someon slept in it. He walks further into the room and hears a SHOWER RUNNING in the bathroom. He slowly makes his way toward the bathroom door. He looks down at the sink next to the door and notices a lipstick resting on the counter top. He attempts to open door, but it is locked. He stands back and gives the door swift kick, knocking it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis slowly approaches the shower -- pulls back the curtain. There is no one there. He looks at the shower wa and notices large letters made of red lipstick. It says F YOU. A little inside joke between Darcy and DeSantis. DeSantis becomes furious with rage. He runs out of the bathroom, intent on killing Darcy.  114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeSantis runs out of the room and back to his car. He SQUEALS his tires against the concrete lot and back onto street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter DeSantis. He makes his way to the bathroom. He approaches with caution -- slowly opening the door. Layin presumably dead on the tile is MICHAEL. The gun DeSantis left on the sink is now sitting limp in MichaelвЂ™s hand. There is some blood on his head where Michael shot himself. DeSantis pulls a cell phone from his pocket and dials a number. He briefly turns his back on Michael.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Yeah. ItвЂ™s me. Why donвЂ™t you meet me at my place in half an hour. I got a job for you guys. A LOUD SHOT is heard in the b.g. DeSantis looks down and notices BLOOD SPATTERED on the wall before him. He slowly looks down at his chest and notices heвЂ™s been shot. He around, facing Michael -- who is still alive on the floor Barely. He is pointing the handgun at DeSantis, panting h last few breaths of life. DeSantis stares down at Michael in disbelief. He touches wounded chest and observes the BRIGHT RED BLOOD on his ha He falls against the opposite wall, knocking off a few pictures. He falls to the living room floor, gasping for air. The C OF BULLETS he took from MichaelвЂ™s gun falls out of his and hits the floor. Out of the bathroom crawls Michael, who is near death. DeSantis struggles to reach into his holster and pull his gun.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Notices the gun clip on the living room floor and quickly attempts to stand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Manages to pull the gun from his holster. He attempts to point it at MICHAEL who finally manages to stand up. The pain is so severe and he is so weak from the loss of blood that he falls to his knees. He keels completely ove face first. The GUN CLIP is just within reach of Michael.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Reaches out his arm, attempting to retrieve the bullets.

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Is now pointing the gun at Michael. His hand is shaking. does not have the strength to pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Is finally able to grab the GUN CLIP and place it into hi weapon. He reaches up and points his weapon at

dialogues.speaker: DESANTIS
dialogues.text: Who is still shaking from weakness. The two men are now pointing their weapons at each other. quickly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG SHOT of the home. We hear the faint sounds of TWO GUNSHOTS going off simultaneously. DeSantis and Michael h presumably killed each other. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: The Golds pull into the parking lot. As they enter the lo wee see a sign reading вЂњMedical CenterвЂќ. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
