dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Gold step out of their car and begin walking toward the hospitalвЂ™s entrance. Mr. Gold is pulling a suitcase behind him. Mr. Gold laid up in a hospital bed, while his wife holds hand.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I just need you to tell me. How serious is it? Several doctors enter and wheel Mr. GoldвЂ™s bed out of t room.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is very hard. A tear falls down Mrs. GoldвЂ™s face as she watches them her husband to surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golds sit on their couch, holding hands. Across from them sits Darcy -- who is anxiously awaiting an answer.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Your mother and I noticed something was wrong a few months ago. There was some changes in my behavior. I started feeling tired. Real tired. Then we noticed some yellow discoloration on my skin. She thought I might have jaundice, so I went for a physical. The doc said my liver was abnormally large so he did a biopsy. He discovered that I have fibrosis.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Cirrhosis?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Right. I keep forgetting you play a nurse on TV. The doc says IвЂ™ve got some scar tissue thatвЂ™s blocking the normal flow of blood through my liver. ItвЂ™s caused a lot of complications. I have whatвЂ™s called coagulopathy. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golds daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. GOLD (cont'd) ItвЂ™s a type of hypertension thatвЂ™s causing my blood to clot. TheyвЂ™ve put me on Vitamin K and a few other meds to try and un-clot the blood.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s why the nose bleeds?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: And youвЂ™re gonna need a liver transplant?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s right.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: How soon?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Soon.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Years? Months? Days? What? stare at each other with concern for their

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Months.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY
dialogues.text: Oh my God.
Mr. Gold exits his home and begins toward the mailbox at end of the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But thereвЂ™s good news, Darcy. Because your father has a rare blood type, the doctor says there shouldnвЂ™t be a problem getting his name near the top of the transplant list.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ThatвЂ™s great, daddy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s not so great.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™re you talking about? (244)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gold approaches the mailbox and pulls out the dayвЂ™s

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I didnвЂ™t want to tell you like this, but...IвЂ™m afraid that...IвЂ™m currently not eligible for the transplant.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Our HMO is refusing to cover the costs of the transplant. TheyвЂ™re saying with my history of drinking, IвЂ™m too big a risk for the operation.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I donвЂ™t understand. YouвЂ™ve been sober for five months.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The pre-operation costs alone are $240,000. ThatвЂ™s just to make me eligible for the operation. ThatвЂ™s not counting the actual transplant and the post-op care. All together, this will cost around $750,000.

dialogues.speaker: DARCY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Dad, youвЂ™re kidding, right? Please tell me this is one big joke. Mr. Gold sifts through the mail an discovers a letter fro KBS. He tears it open and begins reading.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wouldnвЂ™t kid you about something like this. IвЂ™m afraid the only thing that could get me on that operating table now is a miracle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mr. Gold folds up the letter and begins back to the house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golds sit at the dining room table as Mr. Gold reads contents of the KBS letter.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s this?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s a letter from DarcyвЂ™s boss.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: YouвЂ™re kidding? ItвЂ™s only three months late. Not only do the bastards fire her, they canвЂ™t even send us some lousy flowers. What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Dear Mr. And Mrs. Gold. IвЂ™m terribly sorry to hear about the loss of your beautiful daughter. She was a bright shining star that breathed new life into everyone she encountered. She will be missed dearly by everyone at KBS, but mostly by me. I am thankful that some good has come of all this with the success of your liver transplant. From everyone at KBS, we wish you a speedy recovery. Sincerely, Alicia Newman.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: Nice letter. We couldвЂ™ve used it three months ago. Mr. Gold pulls out two AIRLINE TICKETS from the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GOLD
dialogues.text: WhatвЂ™s that?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GOLD
dialogues.text: Two first class tickets to Cancun.  120. INT. CASEYвЂ™S HOME - KITCHEN - DAY Casey is in the midst of chopping up some vegetables for dinner. She walks to the refrigerator and is about to ope the door, but stops when she spots a PHOTO of her and Dar stuck to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: BACKYARD
dialogues.text: Casey carries out a large garbage bag and begins toward t large trash bins. She opens the lid on one of the bins an is in shock to see PILES AND PILES OF MONEY laying on top the garbage. Casey is overwhelmed with joy. She begins laughing hysterically and crying at the same time. She knows where the money came from. INT. LEANNEвЂ™S APARTMENT - DAY Leanne cuts the tape on the top of a large cardboard box a knife. She has received a package from UPS. She pulls o a few random items from the box. A bunch of memories shar between her and Darcy. At the bottom of the box is THE OT HALF OF THE RANSOM MONEY. She is also overwhelmed with joy -- doing a little dance the couch. cur TO: INT. SHERIFF PATTERSONвЂ™S HOME - NIGHT Sheriff Patterson is kicked back on his recliner watching evening news. ItвЂ™s the first moment of peace heвЂ™s had month.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: A live broadcast in front of DeSantisвЂ™ home. A FIELD REPORTER covers the story as several uniformed officers a plain clothes detectives roam about the scene.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: A Los Angeles narcotics detective and a known drug dealer have apparently killed each other at the detectiveвЂ™s Van Nuys home, sometime late last night. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: REPORTER (cont'd) Both victims were killed with a single gunshot wound to the face, close range...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: We slowly close on Sheriff PattersonвЂ™s face as the news continues...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Police cannot speculate as to what exactly led to these shootings, but are calling the death of the two men drug related... The news of the detectiveвЂ™s death does not phase him in least.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Detective Charlie DeSantis had himself been the target of a long, ongoing, internal investigation, linking the detective to several major drug organizations in the Los Angeles area... The sound of the reporterвЂ™s voice slowly fades away as stay on Sheriff Patterson. His face is complete stone, no evoking the slightest emotion. Then...slowly...he cracks smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TAXI pulls up to the front of a quaint little beach sid resort. Out of the cab steps Mr. And Mrs. Gold. The CAB DRIVER steps out and walks to the trunk of the car. He op it and pulls out The GoldвЂ™s luggage. The Golds begin rolling their luggage toward the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golds enter the hotel and begin toward the front desk Directly to the left of the front door, sitting patiently a chair and grasping a flower in both hands is DARCY. She overwhelmed at the sight of her parents. A tear falls dow her cheek. She stands and slowly begins walking toward th We stay on the chair. Before we can witness this touching family reunion, we slowly... FADE TO BLACK. (CONTINUED)
